1123233.content:
You fluttered your eyes open after your shame ridden sleep to notice that your body was cast in the shadow of something. You looked up to find the source of the light obstruction, only to find that it was not something, but rather someone. Looming over you was a tall, dominating Greninja women who stared at your now awake body with an emotionless expression, hopefully in your case because she was skilled at hiding her emotions, and not because she was apathetic.

The Frog Pokemon was, like the Lopunny from before, incredibly voluptuous. However, while the rabbit Pokemon had an hourglass shape that seemed to be slightly more top heavy, the Greninja before you clearly had a pear shaped form. While her heaving bosom was nothing to sneeze at, it pales in comparison of the immensity of each of the water type pokemon’s rear end. While the Lopunny’s breasts were bigger than your head, this greninja’s asscheeks were bigger than your body.

Having to be in the presence of yet another imposing female Pokemon, especially after what had transpired before you fell asleep, you instinctively tried to escape your situation. You were in a cave with a narrow entrance. It looked lived in, with the pieces of furniture here and there. This could have been the Lopunny’s home. Or the Greninja’s. Or maybe they lived together. You didn't particularly care, like how you didn’t care for what had happened to your previous jailer. All that mattered to you was getting out of the cave.

But looking over your surroundings, your hopes were all bat dashed as you realized that the still ooming Greninja was blocking the only entrance and exit of the cave. If you made a run for it, you would most assuredly get impeded in your tracks just by the greninja shifting the stance of her thick, padded legs.

Once again, you were trapped.

Realizing this, the next instinctual course of action that came into your mind was to cry. You wanted to cry your eyes out until your tear ducts would try and hot liquid would stain your cheeks and make a puddle at your feet. But you couldn't do that either. The imposing Greninja’s gaze was to piercing, too powerful to show such an amount of emotion.

Therefore, you opted to promptly curl your body into a fetal position and instead just quietly sob at the hopelessness of your situation. You missed your parents. You wanted to go home. You wanted everything to be okay again like it was yesterday. You wished you never left the tree. You should have waited for your parents to come back. They were probably back home, wondering where you could have gone. It was just too much for you.

You than felt the Greninja’s hot breath roll over your body as she knelt down to your level. You did not dare open your eyes, less you be subjected to the same embarrassing torture that the Lopunny put you through.

“Open your eyes.” The voice of the Greninja commanded you. Her voice was as smooth as silk and soft jazz, but deep and gravitas like a low bass cello being continuously stroked by a bow. It was powerful, but not cold. Authoritative, but not without some level of sympathy. After a few moments and a few more tears, you obeyed. You uncured from your ball-like position and open your eyes, though not wide.

“Do you know why you are here?” The Greninja with a voice as smooth as dark honey asked you. You gave no verbal response, but you did shake your head from side to side to signify that you did not.

The Greninja gave a sigh, her warm breath once again washing over your small body. “You are here,” the Water Type Frog began, “To be our slave. You have already met Lopunny, my mate, and your other new master. From now on, you will be our servant, and our toy. You will do whatever we command of you, whether it be menial, sexual, or otherwise.”

The Greninja paused for a moment for you to once again collect your breath, having been shaken by her explanation so far. Once you had settled, she went on. “If you try to escape, or if you do your tasks poorly, we will hunt you down and consume you, so that you can be of some use to us. You are not going to see your family and friends ever again. From this point onwards, me and my mate are your entire world.”

At this point, the hopelessness of everything thus far came crumbling down on you like the weight of the world fell off of Atlas Shoulders and onto your back. Once again, you began to cry, this time louder, yet still somewhat subdued.

The Greninja went quiet as she observed you cry your eyes out. Without noise, she move her webbed paw forward to your face to wipe the stream of tears off of your cheek. Her cold, reptilian skin felt nice on your hot fur. “Shhhh…”She commanded you to be quiet in a ton enot unlike your mother.

Again, you obeyed the Greninja, something you realized you will be doing a whole lot more of in the future. “However,” The Greninja spoke, shifting her body from kneeling down in front of you to sitting with her legs crossed in front of you, “If you perform your duties without question, and to their fullest extent, the two of us can be very, very kind and gentle guardians for you.”

Another tear rolled off your cheek onto the ground near your paws, which prompted the Greninja to scoot her dominating body closer towards you, her webbed paw moving behind you to rub your back in a soothing motion. “It’s okay to cry. It’s okay, you’re okay.” She said.

You quivered your lip as you looked up at the half closed eyes of your new master, her dull, red irises piercing into your soul. “I-I wanna g-g-g-go home” You stuttered in between sniffles, saying the first words to the Greninja since you met her moments ago.

The Greninja pulled you closer with her push of her paw on your back, making contact with her cool leg skin. “I know”, she responded, “But i’m sorry to say that you cannot. This is your home now. And if you ever try to leave it, to leave me and my mate, we will kill you.” She said matter of factly.

You stifled another sob as she said these words. They attacked your sensitive ears like a load of bricks on your head. “B-butt...b-b-b-utt…” You tried to say more, but the words refused to come out. Only echoes of want you wanted to say sputtered in between your lips in response.

The Greninja moved her other webbed paw towards you, and you found yourself gripped at both sides by the frog women. She lifted you up into the air, before setting you down on her lap, comforted by the warn paunch of her chubby midsection. She than move both paws back towards you back and pressed them tight against you, in turn pressing your body deeper into her own belly fat.

“I know this is scary for you, my little Riolu. But trust me when I say this, being my servant, my toy, my...child will not be as terrible as you think.” The Greninja hesitated at her last defininton of your role as her slave. “You will be well taken care of. We’ll feed you, ‘play’ with you, sleep with you...and perhaps even love you”.

‘Love me?’ you thought to yourself. ‘She’s openly stating how she’ll hurt me if I try to leave...and she’s saying she might love me?’

“Dear little Riolu,” The Greninja looked down at your frail, diminutive form pressed into the chub of her stomach, chub that she has gained from eating countless other Pokemon the size and age as you. “Although you have no choice in the matter anyways...do you me as your new master?”

That was a question that you thought long and hard on. Do you accept the reality of you situation and devote yourself to this dominating, yet perhaps gentle and kind, frog? Or do you deny it and actively try to leave this cave and her at any and every opportune moment?

You stared at it as it jiggled and undulated while the serpent struggles desperately inside. The nidoqueen stretches her back, rubbing her now full stomach contentedly, enjoy the movement of the sadistic predator inside. She gets a little preoccupied with this for a few minutes, until she finally remembered that you were there. “Well aren’t you just the sweetest little thing?” the nidoqueen smiled, kneeling down in front of you as you backed away nervously, staring at her huge stomach. “Don’t be afraid, little one. I’m not going to hurt you. I just had to take care of that cruel, vile little snake.”

As she displayed her stomach to you, she let you curiously place a paw against her soft belly, feeling the distended skin and the writhing of the serpent inside. She giggled as you enjoyed rubbing her stomach, causing her belly to wriggle in your hand. “See? I’m not so scary,” the massive nidoqueen said, sitting down beside you. You’ve never talked to strange Pokemon before, but the kind, soothing way the nidoqueen talked reminded you of your mother, which calmed you somewhat. “Now, just what are you doing out in the wilderness all by yourself, little guy? Where are your parents?”

You rubbed your arm sadly, reminded of how alone you were. “I-I just woke up this morning, and… they were gone!” you said tearfully. “T-they never leave without telling me! I don’t know what happened!”

“Oh, you poor thing. I’m sure your parents are just fine,” the nidoqueen reassured you, hugging you against her warm side, making you feel a little better. “Where did you see them last?”

You’re not supposed to tell anyone where you live… but the nidoqueen seems nice enough. You point backwards out of the tall grass, back to the tree you’ve spent your whole life hiding in. “Over there, by that tree,” you frowned. “That’s where we live...”

“Well, we can go wait for them together. How does that sound?” the nidoqueen offered, standing up.

“No!” you insisted, sniffing around for their scent again. “We can’t just wait around! I have to go find them!”

“Oh, I’m sure they just went out to collect berries. What if they come home and find you missing? Think about how scared they’d be,” she said, and seeing her logic, you calm down. You can’t imagine how scared your parents would be if they came home and you weren’t in your tree. “We should wait for them for at least a little while. I’m sure there’ll be back any minute.” Reluctantly agreeing, you let her pick you up in her arms and cradle you gently against her soft chest as she carried you back to your home. While being in the wilderness for the first time was scary, for some reason, being in the nidoqueen’s embrace was the calmest you’ve been in a long time. Your parents were always paranoid, and freaking out over everything… but the nidoqueen was always calm, and trying to convince you that everything was okay. It was refreshing.

By that evening, the two of you had set up a bonfire underneath the old tree, with the smoke hopefully serving as a signal for your parents to return home. The nidoqueen entertained you with her beautiful singing, and regaled you with stories of her adventures across the wilderness. In one day, she had taught you more about the outside world than you had ever learned in your life. By sunset, you were sitting down on her huge, bulging stomach, the two of you chomping down on delicious payapa berries as you sat by the fire. The serperior within her belly had stopped struggling a few hours ago, but you still enjoyed cuddling the nidoqueen’s soft belly as the serpent gurgled away. But as the hours past, you grew increasingly worried about your parents’ fates, despite nidoqueen’s attempts to calm you. “Should… should we go look for them?” you ask.

She frowns. “It’s getting late. The most dangerous Pokemon hunt at night,” she said, quietly. “We’ll look for them in the morning. Okay?” You nodded sadly. “Then you should get a good rest tonight. Tomorrow will be a big day.” She let you use her soft belly as a makeshift bed for the night; which, after years of sleeping on tree branches, was the most comfortable bed you’ve ever rested on. This was your first time sleeping in the outside world, and you couldn’t help but feel a little worried… but knowing the nidoqueen would keep you safe kept you feeling snug and secure.

With a smile, you slowly drifted off to sleep…

---


The next morning, you were following your parent’s scent once again, with the nidoqueen following behind. You were much more confident now. You would find them in no time!

Eventually, the trail leads you to...
113.title: Slurped Up like a Noodle

1131.content:
You kept low to the ground as you sniffed up your parents' scent. Meanwhile, you kept an ear out for the niidoqueen from earlier. You felt a lot more confident as long as she was nearby. After sniffing for a while, the scenery began to change. Ahead of you, you saw the mouth of a cave. The inside was really dark, and you were worried about what was in there.

"Why would they go in here for some berries?" the nidoqueen said.

"I don't know, but I definitely smell them down there," you said. You ushered the nidoqueen forward.

"There are lots of dangerous Pokémon in there, do you really want to go in?" the nidoqueen said. You paused to think. You looked forward, and couldn't even imagine what would be in there. Part of that was your lack of knowledge on the outside world, and part of that was the darkness. Any sort of monster could be hunting down there. However, deep down you knew you needed to find your parents. They could be in danger, or fighting some Pokémon, or who knows what. All you know is, the only way to find them I through here.

"I'm sure," you said, nodding your head. The nidoqueen said nothing, but picked you up. She held you against her chest, and walked forward.

"Just tell me where to go," the nidoqueen said. You kept sniffing the air, and pointed in the direction you smelled their scent. The nidoqueen followed your instructions. The cave was awfully dark, but your vision was slowly adjusting. Past the darkness, you saw that the walls were simple stone. You heard the sound of water dripping echoing throughout the cavern. In addition, you heard the occasional scamper of some unseen Pokémon echoing along the cave walls. You could swear some of the scampering sounded like stone clashing against stone.

You kept sniffing out your parents' scent, and kept directing the nidoqueen down the cave, rounding particular corners. As she walked, two thoughts crossed your mind. Were your parents safe when they came this way, or were they forced down here? Why would they go down here, and what could possibly be taking them this way? Your second thought was about how neither of you encountered a single Pokémon yet. You definitely heard them, were they just that scared of the nidoqueen?

Neither of you were sure how long you were traveling the cave, nor were you sure about how long the cave was. The silence worried you. You know there was something in the darkness, but you had no idea what. Could they be more powerful than the nidoqueen? Surely not, she was so big after all. But what if someone was bigger? How much bigger could this cave house? Who's to say it doesn't get bigger the further along your parents' trail you got? Did they even leave the cave?

As your fear increased, you snuggled deeper into the nidoqueen's chest, who seemed to hold you closer to her. She may've been your sole saving grace here. You'd probably be paralyzed with fear in the tall grass without her. You nuzzled against her arm in response, trying to calm down. You didn't even realize your breathing increased until you began to calm down. You hugged the nidoqueen's arm tighter, sighing contently.

You kept sniffing, but eventually, you heard the ground under the nidoqueen creak. With each step, the floor creaked more. Then, in a split second, you felt like all the supports under her gave away as you were suddenly thrust in a free fall. In that split second, the nidoqueen tossed you forward, away from the pit. You turned back, and looked on in horror as she disappeared into a newly formed pit under her. You ran to the edge and looked down. All you could see was sheer darkness.

"Ma'am!" you cried into the pit. You waited for any word from her down there.

"I'm ok!" you heard from down there. You sighed in relief, a few tears dripping from your eyes. "I'm gonna try to find some way out of here. Just, please stay put!"

"I will!" you shouted back. You then decided to sit down. You couldn't even tell where the nidoqueen was, much less if she did find a way out of there. However, there wasn't much you could do. As you wondered about her progress, you heard something near you. It sounded like something walking around the cave. They sounded too close for your liking. You tried to turn to the source of it, but it was still too dark. Eventually, the movement got close. You turned to the source, and you could begin to see the outline of something.

It was...
1131.title: A cave

1132.content:
Alternative Title: WHAT ARE YOU DOING IN MY SWAMP

“It smells like they went down there…” You point down into a thick, dark swamp, trees sprouting from the water and twisting high in the air.

“Into the swamp? Goodness!” the nidoqueen frowned. “Are you sure they went that way, sweetheart? I can’t imagine what business they’d have in a place like that…”

You sniffed around for confirmation, and surely enough, you could clearly smell their scent leading down into the bog. “Yeah, I’m pretty sure…” you reply.

She considers her course of action for a second. “Well… alright…” she relents, offering you a hand. “Hop on my back, little one. I’ll have to wade through.” You felt a little guilty having her do all this for you, but you don’t think you could find your parents by yourself. You certainly don’t want to go for a swim in the swamp waters. You let the nidoqueen gently take you in her hands, and place you on her shoulders. The nidoqueen wades into the disgusting swamp water, the brown much coming all the way up to her chest, even at her size. The canopy over the swamp shrouded it in darkness, and through the tangled mess of vines and trees, you quickly lost all sense of direction. You would occasionally flinch at the sound of something splashing in the water nearby, but you never spot anything more than an errant magikarp. “Smell them anywhere?” the nidoqueen asked, obviously not enjoying her impromptu swim.

You sniff at the air, but the natural smell of the swamp overpowers everything else. “I can’t smell anything in this swamp!” you report, your heart sinking. How are you ever going to find them?

“We’ll have to check around on the other side,” the nidoqueen sighed, not particularly fond of this neck of the woods. Seeing your fear, she tries to calm you with some light conversation as she travels. “So, tell me… these Pokemon we're searching for. What are they like?”

You think about her question for a long time. Your parents are all you know, so you’ve never really analyzed them. You suppose you’ve taken them for granted. “They’re… really nice. Sort of like you. But…” you shrug. “They’re always worried about something. Always telling me things are just too dangerous. I guess that’s why I’m such a wimp…” You chuckled a bit to yourself, but the nidoqueen only frowned.

“I think you’re braver than you think you are, little one,” the nidoqueen said. “You know, I was your size once, too. And back then, I never would’ve gone off on my own like you did.”

“Really?” Your ears perked up, a little surprised by this.

Seeing your expression, the nidoqueen giggled. “Certainly!” she smiled, warmly. “I used to be a tiny little thing; but that never really mattered. Once I learned to venture out of my comfort zone, I grew the confidence I needed to make it on my own. I think you will, too.” You think about her words for a while. You, striking out on your own? You couldn’t even imagine it! But the way things are turning out… you may have to. After about a half hour, you were startled by the sounds of splashing. You looked around, only to realize that dozens of aquatic Pokemon were swimming through the water around you, as if fleeing from something. “Ooh! Don’t be scared, little critters!” the nidoqueen giggles. “I’m not here to hurt you!” She lets her guard down, but you don’t for a second. For some reason, you could sense there was something… sinister about this.

Eventually, you hear something loud down the path the Pokemon were fleeing from, as if something huge was slinking through the water. Your heart seizes in your chest as you realize you were being watched, and you poked the nidoqueen in the shoulder. “I… I d-don’t think you’re the Pokemon they’re running from…” you whisper.

As if on cue, a humongous figure leaped from the water, lightning fast. A feraligatr! She had to be at least the size of the nidoqueen, if not larger, and just as voluptuous to match. Worse, she looked pissed -- feral, in fact. The two of you had absolutely no time to react before the feraligatr tackled the nidoqueen, sending you flying. You land in the murky, cold swamp water, which blighted out all light, further disorienting you. By the time you manage to surface, the two huge women are in fierce battle, with the feraligatr trying to dunk the nidoqueen’s head beneath the water. Managing to resurface, the nidoqueen looks you in the eyes, and shouts “Run!” before she’s dunked under once again.

Run? You couldn’t just leave her! You remembered that conversation you had just a half hour earlier. You just had to be brave… confident. You had to be strong, like the nidoqueen was. But just as you were about to come up with a plan, the feraligatr glanced at you. It was just a glance, but her expression was more fierce, more powerful, than anything you’d ever witnessed in your life. In that moment, you realized that you were hopelessly out of your league.

Who are you kidding? You’re a wimp. A coward. You can’t save anybody.

You swam away as fast as you could.

---

You swam until your lungs burned for fresh air, and your arms screamed for relief. Finally, just as your body was about to give way, you reached the edge of the swamp. You dragged yourself, coughing, onto the shore, pulling yourself up by the vines. Once safely on land, you laid on your back and sobbed. You sobbed for a long time.

Eventually you were too exhausted to even cry any longer, and you had to put yourself together and think about what you’d gotten yourself into. Already, you were alone again, and it was all your fault. You felt like you had just lost your parents all over again. The nidoqueen… could she be okay? You felt lost without her, like you couldn’t possibly decide what to do next. Such a big, dangerous world out there, and you knew nothing about it…

Just as you sat down on the shore to cry for a while, a new, sylphlike figure rises slowly from the water...
1132.title: Into This World, We're Thrown...

11321.content:
For a moment, you prayed that the figure emerging before you was the nidoqueen. Instead, to your horror, a massive arbok lifted herself from the swamp water by her tail. Being fully evolved, she was much more “developed” than the ekans you saw yesterday, with a voluptuous humanoid upper body distracting from her long, serpentine tail. You quickly duck into the bushes before the Arbok can spot you, but she smirks just the same. “I know you’re here, little Riolu…” she taunted, as she glanced around the overgrowth. “I can smell your fear.”

She cackles sadistically, her wet tail gliding along the dirt ground as she prowls around the forest. You shiver as you look into her glowing yellow, serpentine eyes, and see her fangs twisted up in a snarl. “You tread on my mistress’s hunting grounds… and that made her very angry…” the arbok woman hissed. You were confused for a moment, before you realized; this arbok must be working with the feraligatr! Great… this day is going from bad to worse. “If you surrender quietly, I promise I won’t hurt you. I mean… she might, but I won’t…” Despite not moving a muscle or making a sound, the arbok is able to sniff out your position with terrifying ease. “Haha! Come here!” she laughs, discovering your hiding spot.

Your heart pumping in your chest, you try desperately to flee. You don’t even make it a single step, though, before her long tail wrapped around your legs seemingly instantly. You freeze up in fear, not even fighting back as her tail coils around the rest of your body. Your arms are pressed against your side by her tail, and soon only your head is exposed, with the rest of your body being completely immobile, her tail almost crushing your ribs. Crying and squealing in terror, you look up at the massive arbok lady’s gleeful eyes. She knew you were completely powerless compared to her, and she loved it. She opened her terrifying jaws, and ran her tongue playfully up your face, covering your head with slobber as she licked you. Your snout was pressed between her breasts as she held you close, savoring your flavor. “Such a tasty treat! My mistress is going to be so proud of me for capturing you…” she smiled, beaming with excitement.

As you look up at her, you are reminded of the Ekans from yesterday. How scared you were… but how brave and angry the Nidoqueen was. This arbok was just as sadistic, dominating smaller Pokemon for her own enjoyment. Maybe this was your opportunity to get your own form of justice. “You… don’t happen to know any Ekan in the area… right?” you ask, sounding innocent.

The arbok snapped out of her excitement, looking at you with confusion. “What? An Ekans?” she said, sounding incredulous. She hesitated, before continuing, “My… sister. How do you know her? What does she have to do with this?”

“She’s… she’s dead!”

She stared at you, jaw hanging open, as if not fully comprehending what you were saying. “... what?”

“Nidoqueen… she ate her! And she’ll eat you too!” you yelled, filled with righteous fury.

She reels back and shakes her head, closing her eyes in shock. “No… y-you’re lying… that’s not… that… bitch!” the arbok whips around, back towards the swamp she emerged from, baring her teeth with a snarl. “I’ll kill her!” In her anger, she seemed to forget about you for a moment, which was all you needed. You managed to wriggle an arm free from her coils as she moved, and mustering all your bravery and strength, sunk your claws into the arbok’s back. “Agh!” She screamed, and while she was shocked, you managed to wriggle free from her tail just seconds before the coils clamped down tightly. She whipped around once again, all her surprise and anger now directed towards you.

Your instincts were screaming at you to flee, but you knew you couldn’t outrun her. Instead, something inside you stirred you to fight. All the sadness, fear, and anger inside you seemed to be created some kind of… energy. This was your one shot, and like the nidoqueen said, you had to be brave...
11321.title: Like a Dog without a Bone

113211.content:
Knowing that the snake woman’s hard scales would be resistant to fighting-type attacks, you instead opt to use hidden power. Your parents had trained you pretty extensively on how to use your various attacks, but you’d never actually used them on another Pokemon before. You channeled all the powerlessness you’ve been feeling -- the fear, the guilt, the frustration -- and channel it into a single ball of power. Just as her jaws flew open, ready to devour you, you sent the ball directly into her mouth. “Mmf!” She yelped as the energy exploded right in her face, wounding her.

While she nursed her wounds, you rushed out into the swamp, dashing through the water as fast as you could. “Nidoqueen! Nidoqueen!” you yelled, trying desperately to find her as fast as you could. She had to be okay; she just had to!

“Get back here!” You hear the arbok scream in fury, giving chase through the tree canopy. You sprint through leaves and water as fast as you can, trying to prevent the arbok from ever knowing exactly where you are. Even through the deepest parts of the swamp, the adrenaline rushes pushes you faster than you ever thought possible. Eventually, following nidoqueen’s scent, you find her being held in the feraligatr’s arms. You were confused for a second, until you realize that the nidoqueen had been knocked out, and the feraligatr was preparing to devour her!

“Oh, Arceus...” You gasp, hiding in the bushes just before the gator woman can you spot you. You watch, horrified, as she cradles the unconscious nidoqueen while slowly unhinging her jaw, preparing to swallow her whole. You had to do something! The feraligatr had defeated the nidoqueen was ease, however… she would probably destroy you in an instant. But you had to at least try! Just as you were about to leap from the bushes, the arbok emerged from the tree canopy, bursting with rage. She seemed to be searching for you, but stopped when she spotted the next best thing; the nidoqueen!

“Her!” The arbok pointed at the unconscious nidoqueen, lunging forward. She didn’t think about the consequences as she tried to grab the feraligatr’s would-be meal -- she could only think that about her dear sister’s fate at the hand of the nidoqueen’s belly. “Give her to me!”

“Let go of her, arbok!” the feraligatr demanded, trying to prevent the snake from grabbing the nidoqueen away. “This is my meal!”

“She killed my sister,” the arbok snarled. “She’s mine!” Due to the slippery swamp water, the snake was able to pry the nidoqueen from the feraligatr’s grasp. She seemed ecstatic at the opportunity to get her revenge, coiling around the nidoqueen; until the feraligatr grabbed her by the throat, pulling her away. The nidoqueen floated limply in the murky swamp water, still unmoving.

“You dare disobey me?” the feraligatr roared, and smashed the arbok up against the tree, causing her to yelp in pain. The arbok was knocked out of her stupor, and suddenly, a look of terror dawned on her face. You almost felt bad for her.

“Y-you don’t understand…” the arbok tried to explain. “She ate my-!”

The feraligatr interrupted the arbok by tightening her grip around her throat. “You care more about your useless sister than you care about your own mistress?” the feraligatr growled, with a calm, deliberate sort of anger in her voice. “She’s made you weak. Your weakness has led you to fail to capture a simple Riolu… and worse, it has led you to disobey me.”

“M-m-mistress…” the arbok managed to squeak, tears forming as she realized just how pissed off her ‘mistress’ was. “I’m so sor-MPH!” You had to stifle a gasp as the feraligatr interrupted her once again, stuffing the arbok’s face into her mouth. The serpent woman struggled futilely against her as the feraligatr slowly funneled more and more of her body down her throat, swallowing the arbok while she was still conscious and moving. The feraligatr’s jaws spread to terrifying proportions, her long tongue licking over the arbok’s breasts as she worked her way down her torso, feeling her body one last time.

You turn away in disgust as the arbok is swallowed bit by bit, leaving a huge bulge in the feraligatr’s throat. You sneak silently over the unconscious nidoqueen, trying not to get spotted. “Nidoqueen. Nidoqueen, you have wake up…” you whisper, trying to shake her awake as quickly as you could. To your delight, she shifts.

“... riolu?” she groans, still-half conscious. At least now you knew she’s alive!

“We have to get out of here as fast as we can,” you whisper to her, trying to get her to escape with you before the feraligatr finished with her meal. The nidoqueen still looks drowsy and confused, but there’s a faint glimmer of understanding in her eyes, and she slowly rises to her feet. As you wait for her to get the nidoqueen to get her bearings, you turn back to look at the feraligatr. All of the arbok woman’s upper body was now trapped inside the feraligatr’s huge, bulging stomach, which clearly showed the imprints of the arbok’s handprints as she tried to break free. The only thing left was the arbok’s tail, being slowly slurped into the feraligatr’s jaws.

You shuddered at the sight, trying to forget what you’ve seen as the nidoqueen takes you in her arms and runs away…

───


“You were very brave back there.”

You were stunned. After telling her the whole story, all the horrific things that happened in the swamp, and that was all she had to say. She didn’t seem to know quite what to made of if it herself. She was hugging you closely, leaning against a tree, going over the events again and again in her head. That was the first time she had been defeated in years. That feraligatr was more powerful than anyone she had ever encountered. “I’m… sorry you had to go through all that, little one,” she finally continues, after she composed herself. You just hugged the nidoqueen tightly. The adrenaline was wearing off, but you were still shaking and crying uncontrollably. Dazed and disturbed, the two of you comforted each other, both lucky to be alive.

After a while, she speaks again. “You should just… live with me for a while,” she said. You realize you had just lost your only lead on your parent’s location. Now how were you supposed to find them? Has the nidoqueen just given up? “I have a den north of here. You’ll be safe there. I will care for you...”

You consider it. You did want to relax somewhere safe again, but… for every moment you wait, the less likely you are to ever find your parents again. Even though it seemed too exhausting, you had to keep searching for your parents diligently! You tried to pull yourself away, and stand up… but you realized you were just too tired to even walk. You can’t keep searching anymore. Maybe it’s time for a break...
113211.title: Dead End

1132111.content:
You loved your parents. You loved them more then anything else in your entire world. They were patient, kind, almost never got mad at you even when you weren't on your best behavior. Your best memories were of the three of you just lazing around your humble but cozy abode. Always thought of what was best for you in every decision they made.

But despite your unwavering bond between your parents, you were simply too tired, too exhausted, to shaken up to continue to look for them. The fear and adrenaline from before had drained from your small body, leaving you with little to no energy.

You loved your parents...

...but they will have to wait.

That being said, you were very, very thankful that you had someone to take care of you. You looked up past the curvature of the Nidoqueen's featureless breasts and, hesitantly, relented. "I don't...I don't want to be a burden. One day...two days, tops."

"Shhhhhh..." she gently silenced with you by tightening her hold on you, squishing your head up against her soft, meaty chest. "Nonsense. You stay as long as you need to. We'll look for your parents again, i promise." She planted a tiny kiss on your forehead, making you blush hard. She was so much like your mother. The tone of voice, the way she talks, she even feels like your mom shiny fur.

"Come on, my home's not that far from here." And with that, she started the relatively short trek to her den, with you pressed up against her body.

----Later----

Most of us feel that we have options for our activities throughout the day, in big ways and in small ways. We have alternative courses of actions available to us, and it’s ultimately up to us which one we take. We are not like monorail trains running along the iron track of fixed destiny that is already laid out for us. We are more like off-road vehicles, capable of making our own paths in life.

Could you have countined to look for your parents? True, you could, but even a prisoner in a jail cell has this metaphysical form of freedom. He can decide what to think about and how to feel. He can typically move his body as he wants, within the confines of his imprisonment. Your imprisonment is your own body. As the hefty but gentle Nidoqueen carries you to her den, you can't help but feel so...dependent. You had never realized how shelters your life really was until now.

You found yourself dosing off in the warm, soft flesh of the Nidoqueen two gelatinous orbs. His body almost downright refused to move, and her embrace had not lessened one bit. You almost fell asleep when the Nidoqueen abruptly stopped.

"We're here little guy." She said sweetly she pulled you away from her breasts and you managed to excert the tiniest bit of energy to face her home. It was a hole in the wall of a cliff face, a cave. But what was interesting about her particular cave was how spacious it was. If the Nidoqueen was just four times your heights, her home was eight time your height. Most caves were just small little punches into the rock. But the Nidoqueen should have one that fits her size, after all.

She walked in, and your eyes needed to adjust to the sudden loss of light. No loose rocks, no staligmites or stalactites, it was almost if not more cozy then your home. "Here we are. Home sweet home."

At this point you were on the brink of shut eye. Your eyelids were heavy and you wanted nothing more in the world to sleep. Noticing this, the Nidoqueen smiled maternally and walked silently towards her bed. It was large for you, but almost too small for her, heap of grass piled in the far left corner of the room. She laid down onto it, almost engulfing it's entirely with her generous rear end and back, and leaned on her side as you were sent tumbling (thigh not for a long time) onto the soft grass next to her.

You wanted to thank her. Wanted to thank her for rescuing you when you were about to be d course by that Ekans. For agreeing to help look for you parents. For letting you stay with her in her home. You wanted to express your gratitude for so many things. But all you could muster with your depleted voice was:

"Thank...you..."

The Nidoqueen smiled, with a glint in her eyes that almost told him that she knew it was for everything you wanted it to be. "Goodnight, my little angel". That was the last thing you heard before you fainted of usher exhaustion, in the loving care of the big Nidoqueen.
1132111.title: Head to her den

choices: You shake free of her influence
11322.content:
Your crying was interrupted by a mysterious figure scurrying out of the water. Before you was a thin figure. They were dark grey, and distinctly salamander shaped, except they seemed to be twice your height. Her underside boasted a purple pattern that seemed to wrap above her sizable breasts, and go all the way down to her inner thighs. They also bore bright, fiery designs over their breasts and around their leg joints. On either side of their tail, you saw two thin flaps flowing like ribbons around their tail. You have encountered a Salazzle.

The Salazzle looks down on you, bearing a grin that appeared mischievous due to the curvy pattern on her maw. Her eyes also carried a dangerous air around her. Her whole stature and face made you unsure whether you could trust her, or whether you should avoid her.

"I don't see your kind around here often," she said. Now, you decided to step away. However, the Salazzle suddenly scurried forward. To your horror, she seemed to move at speeds you never saw before. In the blink of an eye, she crawled around you, and right behind you. You pivoted, and stumbled back again. You wanted to get away, but the only thing behind you was the swamp. You weren't sure what else was in there, and you don't know if they could possibly be as dangerous as the Pokémon in front of you.

"Why're you runnin' like that? I'm not gonna hurt you," she continued. She approached, and you were hesitant to back up. Not because you trusted her or anything, but because you didn't want to go into the bog. The Salazzle wrapped her tail around your back, pulling you up close to her."Just tell me what you're doing here." You looked around yourself, terrified. You were too scared to say anything.

After some silence, the Salazzle leaned her face down towards you. You heard her suck in some air, and then she exhaled, maw aimed right at your face. You could see a cloud of pink poison coming straight towards you before it enveloped your nose. Upon a single whiff, you started coughing. It smelled fruity, yet felt as thick as smoke. You felt like you were being smothered. You coughed and wheezed, and you swear the miasma was lingering. The more you smelled it, the thinner and thinner it began to feel. After your coughing fit, the miasma began to smell pleasant. You swear you felt sleepier the more you smelled.

"C'mon l'il guy, I'm just here to help you. Don't you trust me? Tap my nose if you do," she said. Before you could consider why she'd want you to tap her nose, you felt your body move. Without any input from you, you tapped her nose. "Atta boy. Now, tell me what's wrong.". You felt dreary. In your sleep state, you began to explain your situation. Everything from the moment your parents didn't come home, to the Feraligatr, to you leaving the nidoqueen behind, to now.

"Oh dear! You poor thing!". In your dreary state, you weren't able to tell what tone of voice she's putting on. You couldn't tell if she was being sincere or not. "You know, now that I think of it, I might've seen a couple of Lucarios around here somewhere. A swamp like this is no place for a little guy like you, not alone. Just hold onto me close, and I'll bring you to them.". She sort of sounded sincere, but you couldn't tell. You just felt so sleepy. You couldn't even think about what she might do if you go with her. You could barely think about anything that happened to you before. All you know is, this Salazzle said she knows where your parents are, and she's offering you to bring you to them.
11322.title: A Salazzle

113223.content:
"Caroline what have I said about doing that!" You broke out of your trance and turned around to see a Mimikyu who was somewhat taller than you and from the voice you could tell he was a male. The Mimikyu walked over to you putting one of his hands on your shoulder. "Oh come on I have needs to you know!" The Salazzle who's name was apparently Caroline, growled while scaring you a bit the Mimikyu seemed unfazed by this and let out a disappointed sigh. "Listen Caroline we've over this you can't just use your weird gas stuff on children or just in public its bad for my business when I move and people hear the I allow children to be eaten then no one would want to buy my products. Now go find someone else to bother." The Mimikyu said, Caroline mumbling under breath leaving.

The Mimikyu turned to you "Sorry about her, I actually no where your parents are heck I sold them some stuff and I believe they were heading to a town just East of here." Your eyes lit up in hope. "Can you please take me with you?" The Mimikyu chuckled before answering, "Sure kid besides I need to meet with my real estate agent, I'm telling you a swamp is terrible for business."

You and Mimikyu were walking when you decided to ask him why Caroline didn't eat him She ate me once but I gave her a nasty scar in her stomach so she knew if she didn't throw me up she was going to die." You then explained to the Mimikyu everything that happened including the Nidoqueen. "Oh yeah I saw her, she was looking for you so I told her to leave the swamp and I would find ya, turns out I did, maybe we might see her soon."

The two of you continued walking when you heard a rustling sound, when you turned around there was
113223.title: A Mimikyu shopkeep

choices: ...is there anything I can do to help?
...can you help me find my parents?
11323.content:
An invisible weight pressed upon you. The black appendages in front of your ears rose, sensing a powerful presence. An aura of dread made you feel the smallest you’ve ever been.

         There was a ripple in the brown water beside you. That was all you saw before your nightmare emerged. Surging from the murky depths, the Feraligatr crashed upon the shore. On all fours, she still towered above you. Her head was overhead; her arms were to your sides -- escape was impossible. She looked down at you and opened her mouth...to talk.

         “Are you…,” her voice was slow, heavy, and rumbling. It sounded like a mountain was talking with a mouthful of rocks.

         “...Her friend?” Brown swamp water dripped from her form, soaking the small jackal below. Her yellow eyes bored into you, expecting an answer. They seemed calmer, not as feral; they still maintained a dangerous glint. Her jaws caught your eye. She had rows of teeth. Crooked and sharp, like dozens upon dozens of crooked arrowheads. And yet, her maw was big enough to swallow you whole. A frightening thought, and more than enough motivation for you to try and answer her. But you found your words were too scared to leave your throat. All that arose was a small whimper. You wondered if her prey died of fright before even reaching her jaws.

         The Feraligatr snapped her jaws with a fearsome crack, inches from your face. Her patience had thinned. “Answer me. Or I’ll rip the words from your throat for you.” Countless old scars lined her snout, but a fresh one caught your eye. A crimson line stretched from her lower lip toward her right eye. Curiosity gave you the courage to speak.

         “Did Nidoqueen give you that scar?” you blurted out. You regretted your words the instant they came out.

         “Yes, she did.” Feraligatr said, her voice a rumbling whisper that shook your very bones. “She gave me this one,” Feraligatr pointed towards the fresh scar with a sharp claw, “and this one.” She pointed a claw to her heart. “Heartache,” she said. “She deserves to know what it feels to be hurt there.”

         You were confused. Nidoqueen caring, motherly, and maybe even sacrificed herself for you. Again, curiosity prompted you to ask, “why”?

         “She despises predators. Like we have a choice of what we can eat. She thinks we’re lesser, undeserving of sympathy.” Her warm breath enveloped your face and you could feel the bitter resentment that it carried. “I had a friend. He was a Murkrow,” she said, almost wistfully, “he ate Caterpie to live and she thought he was monster for doing so. She ate him, not because she needed to, but because she could.” A deep growl emanated from deep within her throat. “I was young and I couldn’t help him. But now… Now I am big and she is weak.”

         You felt a question blaze within you. You gather the courage to look the monster in her eyes. You ask…
11323.title: A Monster's Tale

choices: ...Feraligatr drops you into Nidoqueen’s open mouth.
...Feraligatr shoves you into her own jaws.
113232.content:
“Is she okay?” you said, worried for the safety of your new friend. “Nidoqueen?”

“Yes,” she said, “but I have plans for her...and for you.”

With that, she swung a tree-trunk arm around and grabbed you by the scruff of your neck. She rose to two legs and walked away with ponderous, elephantine steps. You were helplessly carried off. Mud occasionally splashed upon you as her feet smashed into the spongious earth.

~~


Swinging in the grip of the Feraligatr, you saw Nidoqueen half-swallowed in the mud. Laying on her back, her chest rose and fell and her eyes were shut. She was unconscious, it seemed — but alive. Feraligatr approached her and lifted you until you were eye-level with the crocodilian monstrosity.

“I want her awake.” She said. “Wake her up. Call to her.”

Momentarily, you squirmed in her grasp but she tightens her grip and your struggles ceased. She turned you to face your giant friend. You stare at the body of the mud-splattered Nidoqueen and you are overfilled with emotion. You speak, “Nidoqueen,” your words drip with concern, “it’s me, Riolu. Wake up. Please.” She stirs slightly. “I’m sorry I couldn’t help you.” At this, she takes a wavering breath, and speaks.

“Are you okay? Is she gone?” She paused. Her eyes remained shut. “Don’t be hard on yourself. I’m proud of you. It takes a lot of courage to leave something you love behind. Don’t think you’re a coward.” At last, her eyes fluttered open and she saw the situation before her. You felt a tickle in your eyes then a trickle on your cheek.

“I’m sorry. I wasn’t fast enough.”

“He didn’t run much at all. He sat and cried.” Feraligatr said, her slitted eyes turning toward you, “but don’t think bad of yourself, jackal. I did the same when this reptile ate my friend.”

“I don’t know what you’re talking about!” Nidoqueen interjected, “I’d never eat an innocent pokemon!”

“But you did. I saw you.” Feraligatr hissed her words with monstrous ferocity. “You didn’t think he was innocent. You ate him to prove a point. You're a monster!”

“N-no—I’m sorry! I don’t remember! But I don’t mean to hurt anyone! I just protect helpless pokemon!”

“You don’t remember your cruelty, but you will know the pain that I remember.” Feraligatr lifts you high in the air and plants an behemothic foot on Nidoqueen’s chest. She shouts, opening her mouth — and then…
113232.title: ...is Nidoqueen okay?

choices: ...comply and pray that she doesn’t digest you.
1132321.content:
Wasting no time, Feraligatr thrusted you into Nidoqueen’s open mouth. TIght and damp, there was little room. Your arms were pinned to your sides. Even with half your body hanging outside of her jaws, your face was pressed to the back of Nidoqueen’s throat. Hot air rushed past you as the walls rumbled and writhed as Nidoqueen protested. You opened your eyes and stared down dark, wriggling tunnel of flesh that was her throat. It desperately tried to expel you, but only succeeded into coating your face with a fresh layer of mucus.

         “You will eat him,” Feraligatr’s voice boomed from outside, “your friend will join mine.”

         “Mmmph!” Nidoqueen protested. She could feel your round head in the back of her throat. She fought every urge to swallow. Inside, you felt Nidoqueen’s tongue stir below you. It moved slightly, rising a bit — pushing you against the roof of her mouth and ran across your belly, leaving it slick with slime. Nidoqueen’s heart fluttered and a horrid realization came upon her: you tasted good. Really, really good. Better than most anything she had ever tasted.

         You shouted down her esophagus. “Help! Nidoqueen, don’t swallow!” Feraligatr moved a hand to Nidoqueen’s throat. She ran her hand along her throat, coaxing her to swallow — and she did but she quickly caught herself. Yet, you were pushed forward. Your body was now entirely within her maw and your whole torso was inside her throat. The walls of her gullet began to lurch, trying to either expel or swallow you. The sticky walls came together, you were in the middle. There was no escape from their crushing embrace. Nidoqueen was most ashamed of the misery it certainly brought you. But not more than the thoughts in her head. You were food, her body was telling her. He tasted like food, he was in her throat — and so he must be food. And you were good food and she wanted you. With a whimper, she heeded her body’s command to swallow.

         The great slab of meat that was her tongue lifted. It pushed the remainder of your body into the fleshed tunnel. You screamed. Nidoqueen felt the most guilty she had ever been. She felt your slow descent through the passage that lead to her belly. Quickly, she gripped her throat, trying in vain to stop your fall. Inside, you did halt. Muscled, powerful walls mashed around your form. You felt the flesh quiver, unable to carry you further. But Nidoqueen found herself unable to breathe with you in her gullet. With a tight chest, you heard Nidoqueen wheeze these words, “I’m sorry,” she said. She released her hold and swallowed for the last time.

         Down, you went. Past her neck, past her collarbone, past her armored chest, and into her stomach. You plopped unceremoniously into a thick yellow soup. You were enclosed within wrinkled walls that lazily churned the stew it housed. You rose to the surface and took a breath. You found, to your relief, that you could breathe.

         “Nidoqueen!” You shouted, but received no answer. It seemed that she couldn’t hear you. Your small voice was absorbed by the fleshy walls — and drowned by the bodily noises of her inner workings. You backed against a taut pink wall. You look at the mixture within her belly and you wonder if that was the fate of the Ekans from before. And maybe even the Murkrow that was Feraligatr’s friend.

         Your world lurched and lurched again. You were battered with stomach juices. You heard gagging but it was quickly silenced. You heard the growl of the Feraligatr.

         “You puke him up, and I’ll put him somewhere even worse.” Does Nidoqueen…
1132321.title: An Un-Willing Predator

choices: ...you saw a Pokemon crying near the scent path.
114.content:
You must've been confused, your mind must've been muddled by the fear of being on your own in the real world, but further whiffs confirmed for you that nobody else was nearby. You sighed in relief. You kept following the scent, and found yourself out of the field of tall grass. He tracked the scent, up to a berry bush. Their scent was thick here, but there was no sign of them. It didn't even look like someone touched the bush. You did, however, smell the scent further away.

You looked at the distance, and saw a makeshift village further away. It looked to be surrounded by walls made of bark, and you imagined the houses within would be made of the same material. The path of the scent seemed to lead directly towards it. You had no idea why they would've gone that way when the berries were right here, but your sniffer didn't lie. They went that way, and, for all you knew, they could be in trouble.

The path forward looked open and safe, so you doubted you'd have to worry about anyone attacking you. Even if someone did, you'd be able to see where they'd come from. You felt safer over here, but you kept in mind to keep your guard up. You walked forward, following the scent and scanning the area for any dangerous Pokémon. You marched, and...
114.title: ...there wasn't anything

choices: You wished him luck and continued on the trail
1141.content:
You didn't notice any other Pokémon as you walked. Your path remained unobstructed during your march. You smiled, thinking you were completely safe. However, your bliss was interrupted by a crying nearby. Curious, you walked over to the source of the crying, a Patrat. You didn't feel it right to ignore him, so you got close. As you did, he looked over and seemed to stop crying a little bit.

"P-please, I need help!" he wheezed out between tears.

"What's wrong?" you asked, trying to calm him down.

"I-I woke up, and my parents were missing! I tried to get some of the adults to help me, but they said the land outside the village is too dangerous. So I tried to head out, but I realized I don't know where they would've disappeared to!" he explained. You were surprised to hear that his parents went missing as well. You could tell him that you could probably sniff them out, but you had no idea how far they'd be. For all you know, you could work long enough for your own parents to disappear for good. As cruel as leaving the Patrat on his own sounded, you weren't sure if you had time to waste.
1141.title: ...you saw a Pokemon crying near the scent path.

11411.content:
You sighed.

"I can help," you said. The Patrat looked at you confused.

"You can? But you just got to the village, how'd you know?" the Patrat asked.

"I have a good nose. As long as you can give me their sent, I should be able to track them down," you answered. Then, the Patrat seemed to get more cheerful.

"Hang on!" he shouted out. He revealed a bunch of fur in his hand. "I tried to show this to other people so they'd know what my parents might look like."

"Wouldn't they just have your fur color?" you asked. There was a palpable pause.

"Now that you mention it..." the Patrat remarked. You shook your head and decided to disregard the question. You bent down and sniffed the fur he held, and you began to pick up a scent.

"Alright, just follow me," you said. You then began to follow the scent his parents left behind, the Patrat excitedly following behind you. The trail led you to...
11411.title: You offered to help

114111.content:
Eventually, you found yourself looking into the mouth of a cave. The scent trail still led down there, but it was extremely dark. The Patrat, meanwhile, didn't seem to mind the darkness.

"C'mon, my parents are down there, aren't they?" the Patrat shouted out.

"I can't see anything down there, what if I bump into some dangerous Pokémon?" you asked.

"I've got really good eyes, I'll be able to see if anything's amiss," the Patrat assured you. You nodded in understanding, and the two of you held hands as you walked forward. The Patrat kept scanning for any bad guys, and you got more and more concerned as you began to see less and less of the Patrat. However, you were more surprised when the cave started to light up. Perplexed, you look around, and began to see torch-light. The Patrat seemed equally confused. The cave was lined by braziers lit aflame.

As you began to move further, the cavern floor began to get replaced by wooden floor.

"Someone isn't living here, are they?" you asked.

"Why would they? There's a village just a short walk away," the Patrat said. You tried to sniff out for any other Pokémon, but you were met with a surprising stench. It didn't smell like the scent you followed, but it really stunk. You covered your nose, your face expressing your disgust.

"Someone else's been here," you responded, trying to ignore the smell. "And my nose isn't gonna help us anymore."

"Why not? We've gotta be close!" the Patrat argued.

"Even if I wanted to keep smelling, someone else is stinking so badly, they're covering up your parents' smell," you explained.

"Dang!" the Patrat cursed. "Well, we aren't gonna find them by standing around." With that, the two of you continued forward, you covering your nose. A few feet forward, you two found yourself at a makeshift door. Wearily, the two of you opened, and saw what appeared to be a living room. There was a couch made from leaves, a knee-high table in front of it, and the floor had some marking on it. It looked like a blocky fist. You two exchanged confused glances before continuing forward. However, a groaning from deeper within reached your ears.

"Dad?" the Patrat asked. He let go of your hand, and ran deeper inward.

"Wait!" you shouted as you chased after him. "It's gotta be a trap!" You ran deeper, and almost tripped down a sudden set of stairs. You ran down as quickly as you could, and found yourself in a brighter room. The ceiling had a large hole in it, letting the sunlight pour in. You could see loads of wooden beams positioned around it, some beams jutting upwards and some connecting two beams. At the floor, you saw wooden dummies, and that blocky fist emblem again, now painted in black.

At the very far wall, you saw the Patrat running up to two Watchogs, who're chained up to the wall. You ran over to join him.

"Jeremy...?" the male Watchog said.

"I'm here mom! I'm here dad!" the Patrat, who you guessed was named Jeremy, shouted as he approached. He hugged up to each of them.

"How'd you get here?" the female Watchog asked.

"It was this guy!" he said, pointing to you. "He helped me find you guys!" You nervously waved.

"Who kidnapped you guys?" you asked as you readied to chop one of the chains. With a quick chop downwards, you snapped one of the chains. The Patrat was still hugging both of them, crying.

"We didn't see them," the female said. You got ready to snap another chain, when suddenly- "Above you!" You looked up, and saw a figure coming in from above. For the brief moment, all you knew was that they were coming down on top of you. You and the Patrat leapt back, just in time to avoid the strike. Now that you narrowly avoided the surprise attack, you were able to see who the attacker was. They appeared to be...
114111.title: ...a cave

1141111.content:
Standing before you was a stoat-shaped Pokémon. She stood twice as tall as you, had purple and white fur, the purple fur wrapping around her legs, midsection, the tip of her tail, above her eyes, and the top of her head. Stranger of all were the long, sleeve-like appendages growing above her claws.

"A Mienshao!" the Patrat shouted out. You've never seen any Mienshaos, so you had to take the Pokémon's word. You held out your hands threateningly towards the Pokémon. Now, you were able to notice her wide hips, thick thighs, and C-cup breasts. The Patrat looked at you, and tried to copy your stance.

"How nice of you to come to me," she said while looking upon the Patrat.

"...Why is that so good?" you asked, still trying to look tough.

"Well, I can't just offer up a couple of parents to our goddess," the Mienshao said, slinking towards the two.

"Offer up?" the Patrat repeated confused.

"Oh, did you not know?" the Mienshao said in a patronizing tone. "Our great goddess grows hungry. And if she isn't satiated, she'll once again sweep through the land and devour anyone she's in the mood for eating. It just so happens that she's in the mood for a family of Patrats."

"Y...you're lying!" the Patrat shouted out. "You just want to take me and my parents for yourself!" After that, the Mienshao simply shrugged. Then, in the blink of an eye, she zipped around the two, suddenly appearing in front of the staircase the duo walked down.

:"Well, true or not, you can't do anything about it, can you?" she said. "Not now that you're in the middle of my territory." She then turned towards you. "And as for you, you don't need to be here. Just put down your fists, and head on out of here. And I promise you won't get hurt."

"No way!" you shouted out. You weren't going to let this gal get away with this. Besides, she was probably plotting some sort of attack for if you ran off. The Mienshao clicked her tongue disapprovingly.

"'No'? Ah well, I guess I'm feeding three different Pokémon to our goddess," the Mienshao sighed out. "Look, just lie down and let me wail on you. I don't really feel like giving my A-game right now." You scowled at her and got ready to attack, but the Mienshao zipped away. like a blur, just above the two of you. She was about to slam her foot down on you both, but you each sidestepped just in time. In the spit second she touched down, you both ran towards her, you poised to punch and the Patrat poised to bite. You both came close, but, unfortunately, that'd be to the Mienshao's benefit.

With the sound of a raspberry, she was surrounded by a thick cloud of gas just before you each struck. Instead of striking the Pokémon, your fist and the Patrat's jaws struck thin air. She had disappeared! But that wasn't what you worried about here. A quick whiff suddenly set your nostrils aflame. It smelled like the stench you smelled back in the cave, only much closer and much thicker. You coughed, covered your nose, and fanned the air away, the Patrat following suit.

"BLEH!" the Patrat whined. "Who'd use a move like that!?" Both of your eyes were watering from the horrid stench, and you seen each ran away from the source of the stench, ready to breath up any fresh air. However, a familiar raspberry noise got your attention. You turned towards the source, and saw a cloud of that gas spreading away from the Mienshao, who was ready to strike...
1141111.title: ...a Mienshao.

choices: He lets the Mienshao take him
You struggle out of her grip
11411111.content:
Before you could react, the Mienshao was upon you, you left staring at her thighs. You turned your head upwards, peeking through her cleavage and upon her face. However, while you were confused, the Mienshao brought her arms down, her protrusions, wrapping around your abdomen. You yelped out as you were whipped around, then brought to her backside, which came down on you. Next thing you knew, your face was stuck between her cheeks, and your shoulders were holding her up like you were some sort of chair. You felt your legs shake as you struggled to stand, having a hard time keeping the Pokémon from completely squashing you.

"You're going to regret coming here," she said. Then, next thing you knew, your ears were filled with the sound of a raspberry as an egg-y blast swamped over you. You coughed and felt your strength wane, disgust filling you as it dawned on you what she just did.

"Get away from him!" you heard the Patrat say. However, the Mienshao didn't seem to care. She brought up a leg and crossed it over her knee, putting more weight on your weakening body.

"Care about him that much, eh?" she said, crossing her arms. "Well, here's the thing: I need to be quick here. I need a family of Pokemon for our goddess, so I could either take this riolu here, find his family, and then sacrifice them for the good of the world. Or... if you wish to protect him, you should surrender. Lie down, let me take you and your parents away, and I'll let this riolu go." For emphasis, she rubbed side to side on your face. You felt sweat pour down your face like waterfalls, but you couldn't tell which was the primary cause: the strain you're being put through, the heat between her cheeks, or the nervousness of the decision. You just met this guy, would you have left enough of an impact for him to want to save you? And even if he did save you, she's just going to take him and his family! What are you supposed to do?!
11411111.title: ...you.

choices: You lie and say you know where they are
You tell the truth and say you don't know where they are
You try to punch the bars apart
114111111.content:
You couldn't see the despair on the Patrat's face as he was faced with this dilemma. Nor could you see him nervously glance between the Mienshao sitting on you and his trapped family. Nor could you see his head drop down in despair as he made his choice. You could hear him turn and walk, taking soft steps forwards. Then, you heard those other two Pokémon get freed, and heard them quickly pick up that Patrat and run. As they carried him away, none of them could see the despair on your face as you realized you were alone with this smelly Mienshao.

"A shame," she said. "A shame you had to learn this lesson today, but you need to learn to not be so dependent, boy. Maybe you'll realize that sooner in the next life..." She spread her cheeks a little more, wiggling side and side to pull your saddened face deeper into her rump, you now too pathetic to fight back against her. She had you deep in, and you heard a familiar grumble overhead.

Then, the first blast of gas farted forth into you, and the horrid smell was already too much for you. Almost instantly, your vision became hazy. And almost immediately after that, your world went black...

...

Later, you woke up, and were greeted with a foul smell. As your vision returned to you, you came to realize there was nobody on top of you, despite the smell. You stood up, covering your nose, and looked around. You seemed to be in some wooden room with blue padding around, like wrestling mats. You could also see a bed in the corner of the room. At one end is a giant wall of wooden bars, crafted like prison bars, with a single door on the far right side of that wall. Opposite that is a sheer wall with a single window. Looking through it, you saw down below were some cement streets, a few Pokémon walking around with some cloth covering their mouths and noses. Likely a result of the thick, purple, fog-like miasma around what looked like an entire town. It seemed like a usual Pokémon town, wooden/stone houses, some being 3 stories high (like the one you're in), only there were very few Pokémon out.

Not only was the drop treacherous, but a few more wooden bars in the window ensured you couldn't pass through. You looked down sadly, feeling trapped. You still felt the horrible smell outside leak into your room. You had no idea what was going on out here. But you figured this was that Mienshao's doing. You needed to get out, fast-

Before you could try and flee, though, the Mienshao appeared on the other side of that barred wall.

"You smell that?" she asked. "That horrid stench? If untreated, it'll grow worse than the likes of me. Our village's plagued by a Pokemon thought to only exist in legends, a being that's cursed this town to suffer smells that carry death itself into our many villagers. As it grows more and more, we all are threatened to be snuffed out by it. To dissipate it, however, the Pokemon of Legend requires a meal, a family of Pokemon. Unfortunately, the land around our village has been growing more and more scarce, which is why we had to seek out the likes of that Patrat.

Unfortunately, you got involved, and now we have even less time to stop this curse." The Mienshao glared down at you, as if accusing you of sentencing her kind to an early grave. "So, if we're going to save this place, I need you to help me. Where are your parents?" You still didn't know the answer to that! But, you figured telling her that wouldn't help you right now. Maybe if you lied you might get a chance to get away from here?
114111111.title: He saves himself

114112.content:
You traveled for a mile through thick overgrowth and rocky cliffs, and when you reached your destination, you were struck by the most beautiful sight you've ever seen. You had… never seen this much water in one place before. At once point, long ago, your parents brought you to a small little pond a few miles from the tree, and even that blew your mind. But this… this was beyond anything you thought possible.

Let’s put this into perspective. You’ve lived in a forest your entirely life. With all trees and thick plant growth, especially with you being so close to the ground, the average visibility was, like, what? A couple dozen meters? You had never even seen the horizon before. But now, standing on a hill overlooking the sea, the big, beautiful, bright expanse of blue stretched out as far as the eye could see. The horizon blended with the sky so you couldn’t tell where one ended and the other began; from your perspective, the ocean seemed to stretch on forever and ever. You were struck by an incredible feeling of smallness, just looking at something so infinitesimally large. As you were standing there in awe, the patrat immediately rushed towards the water. “Oh, cool!” He smiled, his problems apparently leaving him for a moment. “I didn’t know we had a beach here!” You realized he was referring to the long stretch of sand beneath his feet.

“Whoa! Wait!” You yell as you reached a hand out, seeing him approach the terrifying expanse of sea. “I-I don’t think we should go near that!” Before you could even finish what you were saying, the patrat leaped headfirst into the warm, salty waters. You stared in suspense for a moment, before his head peeked out of the water with a smile on his face.

“Pffft! Don’t be such a baby! The water’s fine!” He said, splashing around. With an anxious sigh, you trotted down the beach, feeling the soft sand beneath your feet. You could’ve sworn that his parents had been somewhere around here, but the smell of the ocean was so overpowering, you had completely lost your scent. You had to come up with another plan. You glanced up and down the beach, looking for pawprints in the sand, wondering if they might’ve travelled along the coast for some reason. A few minutes into your investigation, you hear the patrat scream. “Aaahhh!”

Your blood runs cold immediately. “W-what? What’s wrong?” You say, turning back to the Patrat.

He seemed to be okay, but frightened, splashing around in fear while he tries to spot something below him. “S-something just brushed by my foot!” He yelled, nervously. Indeed, you could see disturbances in the ocean all around him, like something was swimming just below. You were almost holding your breath by the time the intruder finally surfaced, revealing themselves to be a curvaceous...
114112.title: ...the side of an ocean

choices: A strange structure on the ocean
1141121.content:
You watch in horror as the water begins to rise around the patrat, imaging that he was about to be nabbed in the tentacles of some horrible creature. It all happened too fast -- the figure burst at incredible speeds from the murky blue water, its thick, curvy form towering over the much smaller Pokemon. You had trouble making out exactly what you were seeing at first; you had never seen anything quite like it! It seemed to be a mammal of some sort, covered in slick orange fur, but with strange aquatic features like the fin-like ridge atop its head and along its arms. “Boo!!” It yells in distinctly feminine voice, waving her arms around as she jumped up to startle the patrat.

“Eee!” The patrat squeals loudly in surprise, freezing up as the stranger loomed over him.

“Kehehaha! Oh, Arceus! The look on your face!” The strange Pokemon laughs, pointing at the humiliated patrat. She teases him with a good, up-close view of her maw. “Better be careful out in the ocean next time, lil’ cutie, or some big old monster might gobble you up!”

You had no idea what was she was… but your parents had warned you about predators that have to subsist off other Pokemon. You can’t just stand by and let the patrat get eaten! You had barely any training, but still, you were able to harness all the rage and fear inside to generate rays of energy in your hand, reading your Hidden Power. “Hey! Leave him alone!” You yelled, running towards the water, ready to unleash your attack at any moment.

She hadn’t noticed you before, apparently, and on seeing you she immediately backed away from the patrat, raising her hands in the air. “Hey! Hey! Whoa! Calm down!” She immediately insisted, not wanting to get into a fight. “I’m just messin’ around!”

You were both confused and mildly enraged when she insisted she was doing nothing wrong. You saw it with your own eyes; she had been planning on eating that patrat! “Y-you’re lying!” You say, feeling a tear involuntarily drip down your cheek.

“Plenty of landlubbers like you come down to the beach every day to hang out, and they have a great time! Ask anyone! I wouldn’t harm a fly!” She frowns. You couldn’t control all this energy much longer; you either had to unleash it, or just let it fizzle out. You weren’t sure whether or not you could trust the Floatzel, but she seemed to be genuine enough, so you decide to just let your Hidden Power fade away. “There you go. See? There’s no need for violence, here.” She nods approvingly, as she gently leads the patrat back to the beach, slowly emerging from the water as she walked up the shore. “I’m sorry if I scared you too much.”

You were awed by her body as she stepped, bit by bit, out of the concealing waters of the ocean. She was about a head taller than even your parents were, and much more plump, too. Her fur was short and slicked down against her skin by the water, showing off her curves in all their glory. The weasel-like Pokemon’s thighs were hypnotizingly thick, and her belly was similarly rounded, obviously big enough that she would be able to fit the both of you inside with ease, if she so chose. “What… what are you?” You ask, both impressed and intimidated by her size.

“Hm? You haven’t seen a floatzel before?” She chuckled, doing a little twirl, showing off every inch of her curvaceous body. “No big deal. After all, floatzels are only one of the finest Pokemon to ever grace the sea!” She laughed as she finally stepped up onto the sand, stunning both of you with her sheer size. She smiled, crossing her arms as the two of you stood in her shadow, gazing up at her. “So. What brings you boys to my little beach? I don’t think I’ve ever seen you around before.”

Just as you were about to respond, you were stunned by the sight of a tiny bulge appearing in the Floatzel’s round belly for just a moment. It was so brief, you hardly even noticed it; but staring at her stomach with closer detail, you could tell there was definitely something alive in there, beneath all that thick fur. “What’s… in there…?” You breathe.

“Oh? In here? Just a few magikarp I had a while ago. Nothin’ to worry about,” she smiled, patting her big, furry belly with a contented smile, only to frown when she saw the look on your faces. “Seriously. I’m not going to hurt you two. These are just some dumb fish.” She tried to reach a hand out reassuringly, but you flinch away, shaking as you stared at the floatzel’s bulging stomach. If she could fit swallow all those magikarp with ease, who's to say you couldn’t be next? Hell, who’s to say those are really magikarp in there? Maybe she just swallowed the previous Pokemon that came visiting this beach. She sighed, seeing the look on your face. “Okay, little dudes. If you’re so nervous around me, you can just leave, whenever you want. I won’t stop you.”

You were just about to take her up on her offer and flee, but before you can, the patrat finally says something. “Actually… we need some help,” he says, and you shiver as he bravely approaches the huge stranger. Apparently, his desire to find his family overcame his sense of self-preservation. Curious, the floatzel leans over to face him eye-to-eye. “I’m trying to find my parents, and-”

“Two watchogs, I’m assuming?” The floatzel smiles. “Yeah, they come visit the beach all the time.”

The patrat’s eye lit up at the information. “Really? When’s the last time you saw them?”

“Very, very early this morning. Said today was their anniversary or something,” she said, looking off into the distance down the beach. “They hung around for awhile, then walked off down the beach. It was sort of weird. Want me to show you where they went?”

“Sure!” The patrat was almost jumping with joy as he blithely followed the floatzel down the beach. You stood there, wondering if he was some kind of an idiot, until he finally looked over his shoulder and waved at you, a big smile on his face. “C’mon, riolu!”

You groaned. You knew you couldn’t just let him wander off and get eaten, so you pretended to follow along with him. “What are you doing?” You whispered to him as you walked. “We can’t trust her!”

“Well, nobody else in my village was any help at all,” he shrugs. “What else are we supposed to do?”

“She’s a stranger! She might eat us!” You insist.

“She seems nice.”

“Yeah, she acts nice,” you roll your eyes. “But what if she’s some kind of savage predator, just trying to lure Pokemon to the beach just to-”

“I can hear you, you know,” she says, and you shiver in surprise. She smirks over her shoulder, tapping the side of her head where her ears must be. Apparently, the floatzel was more observant than she seemed.

“Pardon my pal here. He’s a little paranoid,” the patrat chuckled, patting you on the shoulder. “So, my parents. Are you friends with them?”

“I… suppose we’re friends, in a sense,” the floatzel shrugged as she walked. “We don’t really talk much.”

“Oh? What do they come down to the beach for, then?” Patrat tilted his head curiously.

The floatzel seemed a little uncomfortable with this line of questioning. “Well, uh… sometimes, they just want to... relax together, somewhere… private,” she said, obviously trying to obfuscate her meaning, though you notice her involuntarily glancing at her belly for a moment. “And I give them a cozy place to snuggle in for an hour or two.”

“Cool!” The patrat nodded, obviously not understanding anything the floatzel had said at all. You weren’t entirely sure you understood it, either. While you pondered her response, the three of you finally came upon something of interest.
1141121.title: Floatzel

choices: The Patrat makes the decision for you
1141122.content:
The water parting as the Pokémon rose may as well have been a monster's hideous war cry for how much it terrified you. After all you heard about stranger Pokémon, you had no idea what could've crept up on you. The figure seemed to almost blend into the water, but you could make out its shape.
