It had a definite hourglass figure, with hips and shoulder span that outstretched your whole body width, and a rack that'd probably TKO you in under a minute. You couldn't see from this angle, but the Pokémon definitely had a bubble butt that could probably bury over half of you. Beyond that, she had a dolphin-like tail, fins around its face, and a white ruff around its neck. You encountered a Vaporeon!

"Hey there, little guys," she said. The tone of her voice even terrified you, she sounded like she her voice was trying to pull you closer to her. You were tempted to cover your eyes out of embarrassment, but you knew keeping your eyes off of her could spell disaster for you. She rose up higher, and you felt really small again. Her belly was poking out of the water, and she was still a head above you. You couldn't even imagine how big the rest of her was.

"What brings you here? Feel like swimming? Catchin' some sun? Lookin' for someone?" You audibly gulped as she spoke. As she spoke, she got closer, getting higher and higher out of the water. Soon, she began to stand at over twice your height. On top of that, the sun seemed to sparkle off of the water sticking to her skin. "Depending on what you're after, I could help you~" You and the patrat were terrified. You both knew you may be unable to find his parents at this rate, but this Vaporeon didn't seem like she'd really help.
1141122.title: ... Vaporeon!

11411222.content:
You saw her inching closer to the patrat, the look in her eyes almost... hungry. You may be inexperienced, but you're not idiot. This vaporeon is up to no good. "Patrat! Run!" You yelled, feeling helpless from the shore. Hearing how frantic your voice was, the patrat starts swimming towards the peach with all his might, the vaporeon just standing there knee-deep in the water, watching him go. But as he was swimming, the water seemed to start moving in very… strange ways. Just as he was about to make it, the water started to stream and bubble, as if it was pulling away from the shore all in a line. He was caught in a riptide!

“I… can’t!” He said, sputtering and coughing as he tried to keep himself afloat, the riptide pushing him into deeper and deeper waters. “The tide… it’s pushing me away!”

Meanwhile, the vaporeon frowns, crossing her arms while she watches the pathetic display. "You're trying to just... run away? Well, that really just hurts my feelings," she says in a slightly mocking voice, feigning sadness. In a moment, she put on hand up against her head, as if she was about to faint. "In fact, I think I can almost feel myself... fading away..." Your eyes had trouble comprehending what happened next. Within moments, the vaporeon’s solid form seemed to just… fade away as her body turned to water, as if she was simply melting into the ocean. Just as this process had begun, a wave crashed into her, obscuring her form beneath the grinding sea… and just like that, she had disappeared, just as quickly as she had came. You were awe-struck. Had the vaporeon really just melted into water? Or had she just… transformed?

“Where did she go!?” The patrat said, too busy splashing around in the riptide to notice what had happened. “Is… is she gone?” You were just about to tell him that the coast was clear, when a blob of water started rising up around him, as if it was alive. “Aaahhh!” was all he able to scream out as the water covered him, as if he was sealed in a bubble. You watch in horror as the vaporeon transforms back into her solid form all around him, obscuring his form.

"Mmm... that's better!" She said, standing up and stretching with a smile. She was facing the other way, so you couldn’t see the patrat’s fate, but you feared the worse. Had he been crushed? Erased from existence? Turned into water himself? It was only when the woman finally turned to face you that you realized what she had done. Her belly, already significantly round compared to her sylphlike figure, was now about the size of a beach ball, and was distended to the point that the patrat’s paws made bulges against the furry surface. You watched in disgust and horror as she rubbed contentedly all over her belly with both hands, licking her chops with a satisfied smile. Eventually, she looks up at you. "What’s wrong, sweetums? Didn’t you say you were going to run?”

Despite the fact that you were shaking uncontrollably, you tried to analyze the situation as best you could. It seems the vaporeon could transform into liquid, and position herself in such a way that the patrat would be trapped in her stomach when she reverted back to her solid form. Your parents always told you wild Pokemon like to eat smaller Pokemon, but being an anthro, her mouth didn’t seem like it would stretchy enough to just swallow you outright. This must be her only way of devouring her ‘prey’. Thus, if you weren’t in the water, she probably couldn’t eat you. “N-not until you let him out!” You yell, trying to hide your fear. You were ready to bolt at any second, in case your theory proved one.

"Sorry, kid, but your friend’s a little busy right now,” she giggled. Believing that you’re safe, you stand your ground as she draws closer to you, until she can show off her huge belly right in your face. You shuddered as you saw the patrat’s outline through her furry belly as he struggles futiley inside. “Haven’t you heard? Whenever a cute, tiny Pokemon strays onto my territory, they never leave...”

“You can’t just eat Pokemon!” You insist. “I-it’s not right!”

"My, you’re sheltered, aren’t you? This is just natural selection, sweetheart,” she cackles, licking her lips and crossing her arms again, pushing up her impressive bust. “Despite not being the best swimmer, he dwelled alone into the ocean -- on a predator’s turf, no less!” You look bravely up at her as she towers over you. “At least, when he becomes part of my big, powerful body, he’ll be helping a more capable Pokemon survive…”

“J-just… let him out…” You beg desperately, running out of ideas. “Eat something else…”

"Like what? I’m a predator. It’s not pretty, but this is what I have to do,” she shrugs. “If I let him out, I’ll go hungry for… who knows how long. What’s in it for me?”

“I-I can help you…” You plead, your voice sounding more and more sad and pathetic. At this point, you were holding down tears. “I can find some way to make it up to you.”

“Only way a little shrimp like you could help me is by jumping right down here,” she laughed, leaning forward and showing off her dark, cave-like throat. Her maw drooled a few drops of saliva onto your face, and you were struck by the smell of her meaty breath.

You feel your composure breaking down as you stared down her throat. You couldn’t think up another argument no matter how hard you tried. Really, she was right. “I… I don’t… I just…” You say, feeling sad and helpless… and just like that, you were starting to cry. Before you knew it, you were sobbing openly, mourning the fate of the poor patrat even though you hardly knew him.

She frowns, standing up. “Aw, jeez, kid. Don’t cry. Ugh… you’re pulling on my heart strings, here…” She looks around uncomfortably. “Alright, tell you what. I’ll give you a deal. I can see you really care about your friend, so I’m willing to negotiate.”

She reassured you with a hand on your shoulder, giving you some time to calm down and compose yourself. As you wiped away the tears, she continued. “If you agree to be my temporary servant, and do EVERYTHING I say until sunset, I swear I’ll let both of you walk away unharmed.” She recites her offer. “But if you fail to live up to my expectations, you have to promise you’ll crawl right down my throat yourself, and let my belly churn both of you down.” She drew her attention to her big, furry belly once again. “That’s my best offer. Deal?” This seemed like your only chance to save the poor patrat, but… were you really willing to put your life on the table for a stranger? You shudder as you watch her belly bulge and jiggle as it churned wildly on her ‘meal’. You couldn’t imagine how dark, tight, and scary it must be inside. Then again… this seemed like the right thing to do. What would your parents think if you just left him to become vaporeon fat? You agonized over your decision...
11411222.title: Riptide!

114112221.content:
You kept deliberating. You feared what she might make you do, but if you didn't do anything, that patrat is going to be digested. You took in a deep breath, and gave a steal-y glare.

"Fine... I accept," you said. The vaporeon seemed take aback at your statement as her eyes suddenly widened.

"Are you sure?" she asked. "I mean, you do know what'll happen if you don't follow my instructions to the letter, right? You fail, you're gonna submit your body to my own. You and that patrat. You still want to serve me?" You maintained your stare. You nodded with determination, but the vaporeon still seemed cautious. "Well, if you really accept..." She then held out a hand, holding it in front of you. "...then why don't you kiss my hand." Already, you felt sick. You didn't want to, but you knew what'd happen if you denied you. You came close, and, with little pause, pecked her hand. You tasted the remnants of the saltwater on her skin, but you didn't react that much. With that, the vaporeon's expression switched from shock to glee, as the corners of her mouth lifted.

"Oh you're serious!" she cooed out. "Now, get in the water..." You sighed. You hoped she wasn't setting you up to eat you, and knew if you disobeyed her, then you'd get eaten anyway. You leapt into the water, and the vaporeon seemed to melt again. She dove into the water, and came up underneath you. You suddenly felt yourself riding on her slippery back, and you struggled to stay on when she suddenly swam forward. Even if you despised her, you had to admire the speed.


Before long, you found yourself heading into a cave in the side of the mountain. The ocean spilled into it, and seamed to be steaming. When the vaporeon swam in, you felt like you were in a soothing sauna. Beyond the initially steaming pool, you saw caverns leading deeper in. You could hear some noises beyond them. You wished you were able to actually enjoy this place instead of worry about what the vaporeon had in store.

"Like it? This is where I hang out when I'm not hunting for tiny morsels, she said. Suddenly, that hatred returned to you. You were tempted to attack her, but she still had a belly full of patrat. You had to just sit there and take her taunting. She began stroking her chin, thinking about what to do with you. "I never had a little assistant before. You could help feed me, you could rub my poor, aching body, you could get me some fine beverages, you could be my little training dummy, ooo the possibilities are outstanding!" After her glee, she decided...
114112221.title: You Accept

1141122211.content:
You can hardly remember, but when you were outside, it didn’t seem like the sunset was particularly far away. You’d estimate you still had six hours until your side of the agreement was over and done with.

The vaporeon lays down a flat rock formation, relaxing on her back. “Alright, first order of business. If I’m not going to digest your friend here, I’ll need something to tide me over,” she says, before pointing over her shoulder. “There are some subterranean rivers all around this cave, as I’m sure you’ve noticed. Grab some sea food for me, will you?”

You stared at her, as if wondering if she was serious. “You want me to… feed Pokemon to you?” You didn’t want to participate in the vaporeon’s violent breed of ‘sustenance’. Even knowing the consequences, you were about to turn her down. That would completely go against the point of this entire agreement! You’d rather get eaten yourself than doom other innocent Pokemon to that fate. Just before you can say ‘no’, however, she interrupts you.

“Oh, don’t look at me like that. I’m just asking for some Wishiwashi. I’m pretty sure they’re not even sentient,” she rolls her eyes, before rubbing her hands over her bulging, furry belly again, emphasizing the pawprints bulging against the sides. “The patrat here, though, is definitely sentient. Who would you rather my belly churn up?”

You consider the morbid questions for a few seconds. “Well… if they aren’t sentient, then alright,” you sigh, unable to argue. Obediently, you trot over to one of the subterranean rivers, staring down into the clear green water. It was actually a lot deeper than you expected, and the wishiwashi all seemed to be about 15 feet down. “How am I supposed to, y’know, catch them? I can’t breathe underwater, you know.”

“I dunno. Be creative,” she waved a hand in the air, dismissively. “Just figure it out within the next half hour or so, or else I might get hungry.” You nervously dipped your toe in the water. “Well? Get moving.” You growl in frustration, but still begrudgingly dive headfirst into the underwater lake. The waters were a lot warmer than you expected -- it was actually sort of pleasant. Your ears pop painfully as you descend down to near the bottom, holding your eyes open as you look through the clear water for wishiwashi. They were all over the place, but unfortunately, you were out of your element, and they were able to swim away much faster than you were able to catch them. Eventually, you were forced to come up, gasping for air.

You repeated this process for about fifteen minutes straight, diving down again and again, only for your targets to slip right out of your hands. By your twentieth dive, your lungs were burning from all the oxygen deprivation, and you had a severe headache from the pressure. With a start, you noticed that over half of your time had run out. You definitely had to come up with a new tactic. “You wouldn’t happen to have anything I could use as bait, would you?” You called over to the lazy vaporeon.

She groaned, her nap interrupted, but responded anyway. “There are some berries growing over there, if you really need them,” she points further deeper into the cave, and surely enough, there were some custap berries just growing naturally there on a bit of soil. You pluck one eagerly, and rush back towards the lake. With your claws, you quickly tear the berry to tiny pieces, using the berry juice to attract the wishiwashi to the surface of the water. You waited for a moment, watching a school of the fish swim up to feast on the berry fragments… before suddenly reaching it, grabbing as many as you could!

You stumbled back to the vaporeon, completely soaked, dripping water onto the cavern’s floor as you struggle to carry a dozen of the squirming fish back to the vaporeon. She smirks when she sees you coming. “Alright, here you go,” you said, holding the wriggling fish out for her. You shiver in the cold as you wait for her to take them, but she doesn’t seem to want to move a muscle. “... are you going to take them? I caught these for you.”

She gave you a sly smile. “Well, you’re my servant, aren’t you? Shouldn’t you be feeding them to me?” She teases, and you have to resist the urge to roll your eyes. Lacking the energy to argue, you just drop the fish in a pile on the floor, and climb up onto the stone bed beside the vaporeon. You sit on your knees beside her, resisting the temptation to even glance at her sizeable bust, as she closes her eyes and slides open her mouth. You reluctantly hold the fish over her waiting maw, before letting it drop. You watch as she toys with the squirming fish with her tongue, before finally closing her maw and swallowing, a sizeable bulge moving down her throat before disappearing. She smiles, patting her belly, only to see you still sitting there, staring wide-eyed. “What are you waiting for? Next!”

You continue feeding her the rest of the fish in much the same fashion, watching in awe as they all disappear down her throat, one by one. She quickly noticed you staring, and started to make a point of giving you a good view of her mouth as they disappeared down her throat. Before you knew it, you were down to the last fish, and when you brought it over her mouth, you hesitated for some reason. Apparently, the woman decides you’re taking too long, and leans up. You shudder as she wraps her lips around your fingers, and seeing the look on your face, she teased you by licking over the fish in her maw for a while, sending her tongue over your fingers. Eventually, you can feel the vaporeon’s throat grasping the fish and pulling it from your grasp, as it too descends down her throat. A strand of saliva follows your fingers when you finally withdraw them from her lips.

“Mm! That really hit the spot!” She says, rubbing her stomach with her hands. You look over to her belly, noticing it was almost twice as big now; larger than you were tall! You watch with fascination as she rubs her hands all over the furry orb, feeling the bulges as the fish wriggle around inside along with the patrat.

You now had five and a half hours before your side of the deal was through. You wonder what she’d decide to have you do next...
1141122211.title: Gone Fishing

choices: She ordered you to massage her glutes
She ordered you to massage her feet
She ordered you to rub her belly
11411222111.content:
The Vaporeon sighed in content as she rubbed her giant belly. She tried to lounge out, but she felt an incredible soreness between her shoulder blades. With that pain, he then decided that a simple feeding wasn't enough for her after a day in the water. She rolled over onto her belly, resting her head on the backs of her hands. She sighed out as she got into position.

"A day of swimming and feeding does horrible things to my back," she said, gently rocking her back to and fro.

"Since you've chosen to do my every will, could you, perhaps, tend to that soreness? She sounded like she was taunting him, especially when she said "chosen." You wanted to hit her for that, and even protest touching her, but the bulging of her belly reminded you what you were doing this for. You sighed out, and tried to straddle her back. You didn't know why, but getting so close to her made you feel funny.


"I won't accept anything less than 15 minutes. Show those muscles what for, bud." 15 minutes... all you had to do was rub her for 15 minutes. You hated the idea of touching her, but you knew you had to swallow your pride. You lowered your hands onto her shoulders, and gently clenched. You rubbed back and forth, gently kneading her shoulders, her sighing out in content.
"Don't forget the rest of the back." With that, you lowered your hands to her shoulder blades, and began rubbing and stroking. She moaned out as you did so, which made you feel even weirder.

You went lower, and began to knead her latissimus dorsi. You couldn't help but notice how powerful her muscles felt as you kneaded into them. Her moans continued to make you feel weird. "Get those sides, too." Under her orders, you spread your arms out and began to rub along her ribs. As your fingers rubbed up against her bulging belly, and you felt the squirming underneath her flesh. That sensation was singularly horrifying and fascinating. It was just a reminder of what your doing this for, right? It can't be fascinating, it's horrible, right?

The Vaporeon's grin seemed to widen, though you weren't sure whether this was from your massaging or if she realized something was going on with your head. She began to think, swimmers like her used their legs more often when swimming, right?
11411222111.title: She needs a massage

choices: Has a foot on your crotch!
114112221111.content:
The Vaporeon's stomach grumbled a bit as the Patrat continued to press and push on the inside. He was stirring up her gut something fierce, and the feeling gave her a devious idea. "Alright, now go lower...lower...there you go! Riiiight there!"

In accordance with her commands, your hands move lower until they're resting on her asscheeks. The thought of rubbing her butt makes you grimace, but you suppose there are worse ways to try and save your friend. Your fingers start to knead and rub her chubby cheeks, causing the Vaporeon to stretch and moan in delight. Her stomach gives another weird grumble, and you just hope tha it doesn't mean she's digesting the poor Patrat.

The Vaporeon grins as you work up a rhythm with your butt rubbing. Just when you think that this isn't so bad, the Vaporeon's tail suddenly shoves your sensetive nose into her asscrack! "Heh, let me tell you a little secret. My gas is just the worst! It's so bad that I've knocked a Skuntank out with it! Here, have a sniff!"

A loud, revolting trumpeting sound erupts from her ass, followed by the absolute worst thing you've ever smelled in your life! The stench of sulfur, rotten eggs, rotten fish, and who knows what else all mixed together into an overwhelmingly foul stench! Needless to say, with your sensetive nose, and the sheer intensity of the stink, you passed out almost instantly.

You wake up a while later, only to see something absolutely terrifying! The Vaporeon...
114112221111.title: She ordered you to massage her glutes

1141122211112.content:
Your eyes fluttered open, your mind still reeling from the previous attack. With a grunt, you propped yourself onto your elbows and lifted up your torso, your vision still hazy. When you started to wake up, you felt something between your legs. You looked down and waited for your vision to clear up. And when it did, you were greeted with the site of the Vaporeon stepping between your legs.

"Whu-?" you asked. Your eyes scanned from her foot, up her legs, past her hips, then up to her face. She wore this playful expression.

"Whoops!" she declared in an over exaggerated fashion. "Oh, I'm such a cluts! I thought you might've been a bit of carpet in my cave~" You tried to ignore her exaggerated tone as you reached down to lift her foot, but you felt more weight press between your legs.

"Gah!" you whined out. Were you paying attention, you would've seen the Vaporeon's smile grow.


"Oh dearie me! I can't believe I made things worse!" she played up. Then, a few rubs forward and back stirred up funny feelings in you. "Oh go- I'm messing up again?! I hope you can forgive me for this. And I hope you can refrain from having an accident of your own." She kept rubbing, maintaining a constant weight between your legs. After eating yourself silly and the sky began to darken. You started to become sleepy, whether it was from the workout of massaging the dragonite or the beat down you received but you were tired. You yawned and dragonite seemed to notice. The dragonite nuzzled your head "Ahh, is the little runt all tuckered out. Looks like it's way past your bed time but don't you worry, imma take REALLY good care of you".

You noticed that she walking away from the tree you called home. "Wait, where are going? You've have had your fun now please let me go home". The dragonite hold you to its shoulder "Don't you realize runt we are going home, my home". The dragonite takes flight with you in tow. As watch as the tree you called home fall further and further into the distance it finally dawned on you. This could be the last time that you ever see your home or possibly your parents ever again. You started to cry and whispered a small " I am sorry mommy and daddy".

You tried to keep track of where you where going in the hopes of one day finding your way back home but this proved to be too hard a task for you to pull off and you lose the way home. Finally you arrived at the dragonite home a cave in the mountains. "Welcome to your new home and we are going to have so much fun together". The dragonite grabs the boulder by entrance and seals you both in. You bang against the dragonite's leg "I wanna go home"!!!. She just grabbed and hugged you softly "It is alright little one don't cry, you will see everything will be okay".

You felt her stroking your back and rocking you trying to comfort you. As much as you wanted to stay angry but you couldn't, you were far to tired to maintain your rage anymore and just collapsed on her belly. You had no more tears to shed, just a feeling hopeless as you came to terms with your situation. "It's okay let it all out, I know things may not be ideal right now but it it gets better I promise you". You perked up "You... you really mean that"? "Sure do runt now lets hit the hey it's been a long day". The dragonite little rhyme put you at ease and made you feel better. You muttered softly "Thank you so much" before finally drifting off to sleep on dragonite's belly.
13112111.title: Skip to bedtime

131121112.content:
When you awoke you weren’t in the dragonite’s stomach anymore. You were standing up near her. She looked different much thicker, and bigger.

“Hello love, ready for some fun?”

You couldn’t respond before she fell atop you pinning you under soft belly. “Oh you feel so good! I’m still hungry however” she got up and grabbed about to shove you into her...

You awoke with a cold sweat, what the heck was that about? Why would you be having dreams about the woman who took you from your home. You shook your head and sighed. It was then you started hearing the snoring of the Dragonite, she was still asleep, you remembered how she sealed off the cave preventing you from leaving.

What do you?
131121112.title: You have a weird dream ( or readers choice )

choices: Bath (lucky, she trips and pushes the boulder too far)
1311211121.content:
With the only exit blocked by a boulder many, MANY, your size there wasn't much you could do to escape. The only one capable of moving it was the dragonite and she was sleeping. Maybe you could wake her up but you dismissed the idea as too risky. This woman was a enigma to you.

You just couldn't understand her. how she can be so mean and yet sometimes be nice to you at seemingly random. She was just so confusing and that dream didn't help things either. At best you figured that dream was the result of being crushed one to many times. You decided to let sleeping dragons lye rather than roll the dice on how she will react.

You layed back down and waited for her to wake up on her own. Finally after a little while you hear her start to stir from her slumber. You watch as she woke with a long yarn and a little stretching. "Ahh I really needed that nothing like a good......."
1311211121.title: Stay where you are

13112111213.content:
"Bath, that will make us feel extra refreshed." The Dragonite yawned again as she walked towards the boulder. Your eyes widened as you watched the Dragonite trips on a rock that was the size of your head. This sent the Dragonite flying and her head struck the boulder sending it flying far enough that you could no longer see it. The Dragonite seemed dazed and you thanked Arceus for this miracle before running off as fast you can.

"N-N-NO! Y-you belooooonnnggg to meeeee: The Dragonite slurred before slumping from her concussion. You continued running not looking back.

After some time you stopped as you ran out of breath, panting. After recovering you looked around and saw that you were in a forest that you weren't familiar with. You stood and looked in a circle trying to see if you could find anything that was even slightly familiar but no luck. You started hearing rustling, you slowly walked further away from the rustling before running off again. However this time you felt a pressure and you were pinned to the ground.

What has managed to catch

135.title: ... something indescribable (Reader’s Choice)

choices: Find Explorers in a nearby town
Find Explorers in the ruins of Lively Town
Find Explorers by retracing the steps of old legends
Trek out on your own; the Explorers are a myth, anyway
14.content:
Back in the days where Pokemon were civilized, the Expedition Society reigned supreme.

Then, they were the government, the police, and the innovators of society all rolled into one organization. All the greatest legends were members of the Society, as its members had saved the world on multiple occasions. One occasion being just a couple decades back. They strove to help all Pokemon, no matter how weak or small, all across the globe; and, under their watchful eye and protection, civilization thrived. Of course, when civilization collapsed, so too did the Expedition society… and their adventures are now nothing but old legends and fairy tales…

Shame you weren’t born a few decades earlier. They would’ve been perfect for a situation like this. Mysterious disappearances were common in this region; so much so that the Society specialized in the recovery of lost friends and family members. And just this morning, your worst fear had come to life; you had woken up in your tree, just like all the days before, just to find that your mother was missing. You see, the Pokemon world wasn’t a utopia like it was in the old days. Now, the forest has overgrown all signs of civilization, and dangerous and feral predators stalk the night leaving death and suffering in their wake. In such a world, your mother was the only one you could trust… and she’s gone. She couldn’t have been attacked by a predator, that you knew for sure; you would’ve heard something. That means something bigger is happening. Something you’ll need an Explorer - a real Explorer - to help you figure out.

But only one Pokemon knows where they are nowadays… and you’re really not looking forward to talking with them…
14.title: Zorua

choices: She doesn't believe you, and attacks you
She doesn't believe you, but helps you anyway
141.content:
You tried to remember what your mother taught you as you sneak through the dark forest. Stay low. Avoid the light. Don’t make a sound. You’ve seen what savage Pokemon do to those they catch, and you want no part in it. However, while you were terrified of being alone at first, you were quickly growing numb to it. You had been mentally preparing for this day for years: that day that you would finally have to brave the world all on your own. You came to believe that life was dictated by fate; whatever happens, happens. If you were fated to die out here, so be it.

Before you was the Tree of Life. Once a beacon of hope, it has since overgrown all civilization and driven most Pokemon back to their savage ways. Within its mangled roots laid the only surviving Pokemon who had formed a connection with the members of the Society -- she must know where they’re hiding. Your mother told you all about Xerneas, in her fairy tales. Once, she was the proud matron of the Tree of Life; but it has since grown too powerful for even her to control. Thus, she now lives a quiet life of meditation and contemplation, occasionally feasting on smaller Pokemon. You had to be smart about this. Before entering the Tree of Life, you transformed into a Lucario -- one of the legendary Explorers that is said to have saved the world just a while back. With that, you hesitantly enter Xerneas’ lair. “Who… dares…?” you hear her croaking voice call from deeper within the chamber, sending vibrations throughout the hallway.

“It’s just me, Xerneas! It’s Lucario,” you said, stepping out into the light. For the first time, you laid eyes on the Pokemon you had been so curious about all these years. She still resembled a deer, almost four times you size, towering over you in the small chamber. All the color had been drained from her. Her eyes were cold and seemed lifeless. She seemed like she had been wasting away for years and years now. “It’s... been a long time,” you continue, acting like you were greeting an old friend.

Xerneas stared at you, her expression unreadable. “Lu… cario…?” She whispers to himself, as if she was dreaming. You stand there silently, praying that she believes you...
141.title: Tree of Life

choices: Ask Lucario and Braixen about your mother
1411.content:
For the first time in a decade, Xerneas’ face softened. “Lucario… it’s been so long...” she said, noticeably on the edge of tears. You were starting to feel bad for tricking her like this… but she would’ve eaten you otherwise. “I’m… so sorry. I failed you. The Tree of Life… I couldn’t control it…” You walked tentatively up to the once-legendary Pokemon as tears dripped down her cheeks, and you placed a comforting paw on her snout.

“It’s alright, Xerneas. Nobody could,” you said, in as soothing a voice you can muster. Luckily, it’s been so long that the Xerneas must’ve forgotten what Lucario’s voice sounded like. She was crying openly now, and you take another step forward, hugging her around her huge neck. She wrapped her head around your back, and the two of you hugged for a long time while she quietly sobbed. “It’s okay. It’s okay. There was nothing anybody could’ve done,” you whisper, trying to reassure her. The Tree of Life has caused millions of deaths, and plunged her kingdom into savagery, so you understood why she would be so upset. Eventually, she composes herself, and you sit down by her side, leaning against her soft belly while she laid there.

“I’m… so glad that you’re okay,” she said, quietly. “It’s nice to have someone to talk to… after all these years.” You wanted to just ask her where the Explorers are and leave, but you felt really bad for the Xerneas, so you decide to stick around for a while. This was probably the safest place to be tonight, after all, so you decide to stay with Xerneas until morning. You quietly cuddled with the deer while she vented all of the frustrations, the guilt, the loneliness, the terror she’s been feeling over the past few decades. You found that you could relate to her, in a weird way. “I… guess it’s time to get some sleep, then,” She said, after the two of you had talked for a couple of hours straight. At first, you felt guilty for posing as the Lucario; but it seems to have made her happy, at least.

“Alright. Good night,” you say, turning over. You go to sleep using the Xerneas’ huge, soft belly as a sort of pillow, bringing you a welcome feeling of closeness. The legendary Pokemon wasn’t nearly as scary as you thought she would be… in fact, you almost never felt safer. In the morning, Xerneas prepares a delicious breakfast, and the two of you have a much more jovial conversation over cheri berry galette and salad. She certainly seemed happier than she did when you first met. After the two of you quietly watch the sun rise over the forest, you feel the need to pop the question. You wished you could stay with Xerneas forever, but with every moment that passes, your chances of finding your mother decrease. “Xerneas?” you said. “I am sorry, but I will have to take my leave. I have… important business.”

Xerneas seemed saddened, but understanding. “I… understand. I am really glad we were able to see eachother again,” she sighed. “Is there any way I can help you on your journeys?”

“Actually, there is,” you reply. “I need to find other members of the Society. Think you could assist me with that?”

“Of course. I think I’m... still connected to them. Hold on...” she said, and closed her eyes, as if concentrating on something. You sat in silence for a while, until she had an epiphany. “Yes… yes, I see them. There are some in the salt flats, to the east,” she revealed, without even opening her eyes. You frowned. The salt plains? Your mother always said that she hated that place. Regardless, you were grateful.

“Thank you, Xerneas. That is a great help,” you say as you stand up, looking out over the tranquil forest. “It was nice talking to you.”

“You too...” she said sadly, as you walked away. Once you were out of sight, you transformed back into a zorua, and continued your journey.

---

The salt plains were barren and miserable. The ground resembled snow, but was burning hot beneath your paws. Every once in awhile, the wind would blow sand in your eyes, just to add insult to injury. You couldn’t imagine why any Explorers would want to be here; this place seemed empty. But you had to trust the Xerneas, as she was your only lead. As you walked, you eventually realized the salt was shifting strangely beneath you, as if it was alive. You were confused for a moment, only for another Pokemon to emerge from beneath the sands! It was a hippowdon! You leap out of the way just seconds before it can close its jaws around you, before turning to face your opponent. The hippowdon looked typical for a savage Pokemon, with scars littering its body, salt filling its shells, and glowing red eyes devoid of feeling or higher consciousness. Before you could let out an attack, it leaped forward, closing its jaws around you once again. “Help!” you scream as you’re rolled around on its tongue, just narrowly missing the hippowdon’s sharp teeth.

In that moment, some powerful force struck the hippowdon in the side. It spit you out by reflex, and you collapsed onto the ground, covered in saliva. You could only watch as a Lucario emerged from the salt flats, and blasted the hippowdon with a powerful aura sphere, destroying the creature’s protective shell. The hippowdon turned to fight its aggressor, only to be attacked from behind by a burst of fire, as a braixen emerged from the sands as well. The hippowdon yelped as the flames struck its unprotected skin, and burrowed its way back into the thick salt. The battle was over almost before you could even register what had happened. With that finished, the lucario leaned over, offering you a helping paw. “Are you alright, little guy?” he asked, and you nodded silently as you stand and get your bearings together. You were stunned as you got a closer look at your saviors; a braixen and a lucario, both with red bandanas around their necks. You recognized them!

“Y-you’re the Pokemon that saved the Tree of Life!” you gasped. You had heard of these two Pokemon all the time in fairy tales, but you never knew they were actually still alive! Just a couple decades ago, they defeated the anti matter, and prevented all the life from being drained from the world. The two of them had defeated legendary Pokemon with ease, and travelled the world during their epic quests.

The braixen looked flattered. “Well… that happened a long, long time ago,” she said, humble. “But yeah, that’s us, I guess.”

“My mother told me all about you! Is it true you really battled with legendaries?” you asked, excitedly.

“Uh, let’s save the questions for when we’re not in the salt plains,” the braixen dismissed your query. “We have a safe place nearby, little guy. Do you want to come along?”

“Of course!” you smiled, skipping with excitement as you followed after them. This was perfect! This duo could do anything… they could definitely find your mother! All the fear and anxiety you’ve been experiencing melted away. The duo led you far from the salt plains, deep into the most secret areas of the forest. Eventually, you came across their hideout; a palace built into the old trees of the forest ▼
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/ori...
. It was the most beautiful thing you’d ever seen! The palace was littered with other friendly pokemon, all seemingly working on expanding the place. You had never seen this many Pokemon in one place before! “Whoa...” you gasped, hardly able to believe your eyes. “What is this place?"

“Well… we call it ‘Paradise’,” the braixen said, sounding a little embarrassed. “I mean, it may not necessarily be a paradise yet, but that’s the end goal.”

“We’ve been trying to build a community here. Somewhere safe,” the lucario explained in more detail. You wandered around, saying hello to all the friendly Pokemon. Compared to living alone in the savage forest, this place really did seem like a paradise. “We have important business to take care of, so you should just get settled in, little guy. If you need anything, you should talk to Kangaskhan.” You wander around, still awed by your surroundings. You had never seen anything like it before. There was so much to be done! … where to start?
1411.title: Paradise

151311.content:
You are a small Torchic, sleeping against a tree. A few days ago, your mother had told you to be careful because bigger pokemon might find you “appetizing”. You ignored this and kept having fun and messed around. However, as you slept, you started to have a nightmare. You were being chased by a powerful pokemon. You tried to get away, but the pokemon grabbed your leg, soon dangling you. Gardevoir’s face was in front of you, smiling. You struggled as you watched her mouth open. She easily placed you in and swallowed.

You woke up, startled and looked around. The sun was high in the sky and you were safe and sound. You looked around and started to panic, your parents weren’t here! You took a few deep breathes and calmed down, surely they didn’t go that far. You got up and started to walk. Even if they did go far, you were ready to take the journey wherever it led. You continued…

This is a big volcano. They could be anywhere. You could spend days looking for them on this mountain! You had to carefully consider where they might've gone to limit your search.

151331.content: Now, which starter are you?
151331.title: Generation 5

1513313.content:
You're an Oshawott. You live in a tree that's relatively close to the ocean. When you asked your parents why you didn't live in the water, they told you that there were terrifying, hungry Pokémon in it. Being Samurotts, they were able to swim through it very quickly. You, however, weren't as fast. You figured they may've either headed that way to get food, or they might've travelled on land somewhere. Of course, you had no idea where.

If they went by water, they must've gone to some island. If they went by land, they could've gone to any berry bush nearby. And there could be berry bushes somewhere in the nearby jungle or at a town established by some Pokémon. Your parents always warned you against going to either of them, so you were scared to go either way. However, it's been a long time since you saw them. Where will you go?
1513313.title: Oshawott

15133131.content:
Since it was so close by, you figured the most likely route would've been through the water. All you'd have to do is, hopefully, find a bush close to your home. Your parents should be nearby. You dove into the water and began to swim out. You felt your heart swell up with fear as you continued forward. You had to remember to keep an ear out for any hostile Pokémon. You heard all about how they'd snatch up unfortunate Pokémon and eat them or drag them off to do who knows what to them.

You swam and kept an eye out for any islands, when, suddenly...
15133131.title: Out in the ocean

choices: The Primarina's tail began to coil around you
151331312.content:
The water terrified you. The sea may be calm, but it always hid a slew of creatures. You heard tales of how some would snatch and gobble up anyone treading the surface, how some would attract other Pokémon straight into their maw, and worse. After hearing so much about how dangerous the waters were, you wanted to avoid it. But now that your parents were missing, you had to swallow your fear and tough it out. And... hopefully... you'll find them soon enough.

However, a break in the ocean would tell you otherwise. You heard the water shift unnaturally, as if coming from behind and circling around you. You froze up in fear upon realizing something was surrounding you. Now may not be a good time to freeze up as you would soon learn when something rose from the water. They're head, neck, and torso appeared pearl-white, they had a short snout dotted by a pink bump, sparkling eyes, and wavy blue hair. They also bore D cup breasts, hidden behind a thick frill. You were approached by a Primarina.

"I haven't seen you around here," the Primarina said. She didn't sound dangerous. In fact, she bore the kind of voice you'd expect to hear lulling you to sleep at night. "Are you lost?" Her voice made you want to answer her, but you remembered hearing how dangerous strangers were. You grew silent, and the Primarina tilted her head in confusion. "Can you hear?" You attempted to back away, but a few strokes backwards and you bumped into a tail. Like you feared, she had you encircled.

"You look so scared," the Primarina said. "What's wrong, little guy?"
151331312.title: ...a Primarina ambushed you

1513313122.content:
The big Primarina seemed to be a nice sort of Pokémon. You remembered what your parents said about strangers, that they were dangerous and manipulative, but you had no idea of how true their words were, having never ventured past your home. You decided to give this stranger the benefit of the doubt, genuinely concerned about you. "I...I can't find my parents." You relent with a small quiver in your voice. "They never came home last night, a-and I'm trying to find them..."

"You're a very brave little boy for going out all on your own." The Primarina cooed in a soothing voice as you shared with her your situation. You let out a small gasp as you felt the Pokémon's tail slowly wrap around your sides in the water, not an uncomfortable vice grip, but strong enough for you to not escape. "I...I wish I could wish you good luck on your quest to find them, but I'm afraid I already know where they are."

"You was my parents!?" You raised your voice as Hope began to swell up inside of you. You knew you shouldn't have gotten your hopes up, but you couldn't help it! The big, nice Primarina lady was going to lead you back to your mom and dad, back to their loving embrace. "Where are they?"

"Oh, you poor little thing." The Primarina leaned in to give you a sad nuzzle on your forehead, making you blush and squirm. She swam gently to a nearby rock and heaved herself onto it out from the water, giving you a clear view of her form. The Siren Pokemon was heavily rotund with a big, fat stomach jutting a couple of feet from her midriff, a thick tail smothered in blubber jutting from it in place of her legs. "Too young to understand how the world works. I'm afraid they're right here, little Oshy."

The pudgy Primarina patted her very well fed tummy at the end of her sentence, making the white flab Bob up and down and side to side. At first, you didn't understand what the bigger Pokémon was saying, but all too suddenly the realization struck you like a ton of bricks on your head. "Y-y-you...you ate them?" You looked up to the massive mermaid's year and watched it nod in affirmation. "B-But...no! No, I want my parents back! Give me back my mom and dad!"

You began to whimper and cry as the Primarina gently released you from her tail onto her soft tummy, soft with the pudge made from your mom and dad's bodies. You tried to be calm and rational, knowing that you were in the presence of the same Pokémon that turned your parents into fat, but you were overcome with emotion. They were everything you had, and now...they were gone.

"It was nothing personal, little Oshy." The Primarina softly stroked your head, comforting you in your state of emotional turmoil. "Your parents seemed to be very nice folk, and they talked a great deal about you before I churned them up. But I'm afraid they forgot to teach you an important lesson about the world before they left it. Out here, the bigger Pokémon eats the little Pokémon, and as you can see, I'm a very big Pokémon."

"But...why?" You asked in between sniffles, looking up to the Primarina for any sort of support, any kind of comfort that she could give despite her being the reason you were now an orphan. "Why did you have to eat...them?"

"Because I was hungry." The Primarina shrugged her shoulders, not understanding why what she did was causing such an emotional reaction in you. She figured that you must have been very, very sheared and was coming out into the world for the first time. "That's just how I am, and how a lot of other Pokémon are. What do you want me to do, starve myself on berries and kelp?"

"...no." You curled up on top of the Primarina's tummy into a protective ball, exhausted from the emotions inside of you and scared of how alone you were in such a big, dangerous world. "I want my mom and dad back."

"Oh, little oshy. I know you do, but I'm afraid they're gone for good." She hugged your body into her own, her comfy and malleable form making you sink into her fatty flesh. "But if it really does bother you that much, the least I could do is help you join them." Suddenly, you felt yourself being lifted up into the air by the Pokemon's flippers. You open your eyes from your protective shell to see the mermaid's maw opened wide with a tongue lazily rolled over it. This was it, you were about to get eaten! By the same Pokémon that date your parents, no less!

You began to squirm and panic, but your feeble strength was no match for the Primarina's. Before you entered past the point of no return, you suddenly got into your mind the last ditch idea to save yourself. "Wait, I'm too small to be food, not even a snack!" You wail, stopping the Pokémon from dropping you onto her tongue at the last second. "Isn't there any use for me that doesn't involve me...turning into fat?
1513313122.title: You eventually gave in

choices: She asked for a belly rub
She asks him to act as a cushion while she lounges
15133131222.content:
The Primarina looked up at you curiously as you begged her. You could practically see the gears grinding in her head as she considered. She seemed to contemplate pros and cons and alternatives. It seemed that, in the end, she decided she was too full for now. So, she shrugged her shoulders.

"I could use myself a little butler," she said. At that, you nodded your head. Though, honestly you didn't seem to care what the alternative was. You needed to make sure you weren't eaten! At that, she brought you down, instead tucking you under her arm. She then dove down, dragging you along while holding you close... close to that extended belly...

Soon, you saw she brought you down to the sea floor, towards an undersea cave. She swam through it, and soon brought you up onto a submerged cliff, laying you down before she brought herself up, lying on the cliff as well.

"It's been awfully lonely down here, not that I particularly mind. Though it doesn't hurt to have a little guy pamper me," she cooed out. You stood up nervously, looking over her form and fearing your fate. It seemed you might have to serve her for a while. Who knows what'd happen if you defied her?
15133131222.title: You Could Be Her Pet...

Donna gets hungry in her sleep
151331312222.content:
ou look up at the giant Primarina, casually looming over you with her pudgy body. She was smiling ear to ear warmly, the kind of smile you would give to a new favorite toy. She clasped her pale white flipper-hands together happily as an idea for what to do with you popped into her mind. She bent down, indirectly squishing her slick, breasts together in front of you. You blushed and squirmed from the show, they were like wet water balloons…

“I suppose I should tell you my name, since you’re my pet now.” The Primarina grasped one of your shoulders as she slithered her way around you, dragging her thick with blubber mermaid tail along the ground. Where the tail and the waist met they're was a pair of wide hips and a soft bottom that giggled like mad. “My name is Donna, but you may call me...mistress.”

“O-okay…” You stutter a little with fear as Donna sensually circled your form, eyeing you up like a delicious pice of meat. You would have to do your best to please your new captor, otherwise you’ll fall in the same situation your parents faced...digesting in her soft tummy and adding to her plush frame. “What wo-would you like me to do for you, m-mistress?”

“Why, my little Oshy, it’s actually quite simple.” Donna cooed as she essentially tackled you from the behind, her breasts squishing against either side of your face. Your head was practically consumed by the massive, warn bosom, and you panicked and struggled for air. Smirking, your captor refused to release you from her slippery mammaries. “ You’re gonna be my squish toy!”

“Your...your squish toy?” You struggled to ask as the fat boobs plugged up any flow of air, forcing you to push your stubby hands into the tit flesh to speak. They were warn and giggly like gelatin and soft enough to engulf your hands. You looked up past the canyon of her cleavage to see the Primarina silently smirking at your predicament, humming a happy tune. “That do-sen’t sound too fun…”

“Oh, but your so wrong!” Donna taunted as she forceably removed you from her clevage, only to spin around with suden grace and flexability to pin you under her jiggling rump, shaking and grinding it into the ground to get you to squirm. “We’ve only just startred, and I’m having loads of fun! And don’t tell me you’re not getting a little enjoyment out of this~” She teased as she lifted herself up and down, grinding your body into the cliff.

You didn't want to admit it...but it was just a little fun. The pressure that Donna’s body gave out was heavy and crushing, but the plush softness and warmth of her padding got you a little excited. Rubbery and slick but heavy as a ton of bricks, you didn't fully understand why you were enjoying it, bt couldn't deny that you were at the same time.

“I see that blush~” Donna purred as she peered over her shoulders to get a good look at you. Suddenly, with a final shake and a bounce the pressure, and the Gourgeist, are gone! It's as if she's vanished. Maybe she got bored with you or maybe she figured you had learned your lesson. Hell, maybe she was late to an appointment. You didn't care what the reason was and you weren't going to wait around to ask questions. As soon as your body allowed you to, you took off running in the direction of the water!

You knew the ocean was dangerous, but at least there you'd be able to move quicker and hide better if that disturbing ghost type returned. As you ran, branches and brushes slapped against your arms and face. The jungle seemed to get more and more dense as you ran. You pulled out your shell blade and cut through the vegetation to clear a path for yourself, but the more you cut away the more that kept coming! It was as if the forest itself was chasing you!

At several points, you managed to get your legs tangled up in the brush. You nearly fell on multiple occasions, but managed to continue moving forward. You thought you heard a light sound of a familiar laughter from somewhere nearby, but it was so soft you ignored it. Chalking it up, instead, to your nervous mind playing tricks on you.

Finally, you reached the water's edge. You paused for a few moments to catch your breath as you prepared to dive in. Your form was perfect and you closed your eyes ready to escape into the peaceful, you hoped, waters.

CRASH!

You hit the ocean floor face first. You opened your eyes in confusion, but what you saw didn't provide many answers. You looked up in awe as you were surrounded by a wall of water that looked as if it were being held back by some unseen force. The ocean stood high above you and seemed to be normal everywhere, except for the spot you crash landed. You thought back and you were certain this odd hole in the water wasn't there when you jumped.

Before you could wrap your mind around this, your body was flattened by an unseen force. You felt yourself pressed and pinned by something large, fleshy, and round, but whatever it was you were able to see right through it. As you heard the muffled laughter return, you realized what was going on.

Gourgeist!

She had never actually let you go, she had just vanished and was following you this whole time. The branches and brush in the forest, the sudden hole in the ocean, that all had to be her! This was definitely her seated on top of you once again. Your realization was confirmed when you heard her voice.

"How's this for rough little Oshawott?" she cooed, grinding your body deep into the rough sand of the dry spot you previously occupied. Well, still occupied beneath her.

Just as suddenly as before, the weight is gone. Your eyes shoot open as you see the walls of water cascade over you, no longer being held back. In your flattened, battered state, you're in no position to swim and the wild waves of the sea toss your body in all directions. By the time you gathered your wits and your strength, you were far deeper than you had ever gone, even with your parents!

You think about swimming to the surface, but realize that Gourgeist is likely still tracking you somewhere. Instead, you swim deeper underwater, praying that you don't come across a hungry Gyrados. You swim, but have no idea what to do next. What does fate decide for you?

"only if and when you're ready" he says in the most reassuring tone you have ever heard, you can hardly believe that this is the same flygon you ran into not even ten minutes ago!

you feel like you're going to faint! eventually you decide to...
1521113.title: ...pulls out, and asks what's wrong

15211132.content:
at first you're not sure why you're even considering this, but the more time you think about, the more you find reasons to say yes; you briefly wonder how fast Stockholm Syndrome can set in before you say "alright i'll be your mate..."

"excellent!" he says as his face lights up "first things first we should properly introduce ourselves; my names Rex, and you are?"

you're honestly taken aback a bit by this for several reasons, but after a bit you say "i don't think i have a name, my parents always referred to me as son or my boy..."

he seems a bit annoyed this as he says "well that won't do at all, i guess i'll have to give you one" he then pauses for a moment then says "how about prince?" you go to ask why, but he continues when he sees the confusion on your face "because that's how you've been treated like up until now"

"sure that'll work" you say not sure you'll even remember that name

"great! oh and you don't have an evolution i mind already i'd like to see if i can get you to evolve into a sylveon" he say and you aren't sure how to respond so you just nod

and with that he picks you up and puts you on his back and takes off with a powerful flap of his wings "where are we going?" you ask

"to the cave in my territory where i- we sleep" he says, and with that the rest of the flight goes by in silence as you hold on and just enjoy the view

finally though after a good ten minutes he lands in front of what you assume to be his cave, and he puts you down in front of him and says "before you go in there is one thing we need to take care first" he says and when he sees that you're waiting on him to elaborate he goes on "it's an alpha thing... i, well... i need to mark you..."

your eyes go wide as you're left speechless "i guess the easiest way to do this is to bite the tip of one of your ears off and use a sitrus berry juice to stop the bleeding" he says then goes over to a bushes where some sitrus berrys are growing

this gives you just enough time for your brain to realize that this is definitely the point of no return, and a part of wants to back down and say that you changed your mind, but you push that part of you down, you've made up your mind, nerves be damned!

"okay i'll try and do this a fast as possible, so just grunt your teeth and hold your breath" he says as grabs your left ear, and you do as he says as he bites down on your ear; the pain is in intense, but just as fast it came, it went as you feel the sitrus berry working its magic on your ear

when he lets go of you, you take a moment to pull down your ear just to look at the physical change to your body; true to his word it's just the tip of your ear that's gone, you take in the details of the bite marks along you ear

"okay head inside, i would go ahead and start on your lessons now, but i figure you've been through enough today" Rex says and you have no complaints with that; even though you haven't been up for that long you feel exhausted, so you head inside, get comfortable and drift off to sleep.
15211132.title: agree to be his mate

choices: The two of you head to a local village to gather information

Suddenly, the two of you are ambushed!
1522.content:
"Well, well, well...hello there handsome."

Your head turned towards your right as heavy footsteps could be heard thudding on the forest floor coming into he small cleaning with the berry bush, the ground and plants around you as a large figure soon lumbered out of the canopy shadows and into the daylight.

It was a Snorlax.

...oh the irony of it all.

Stepping into he clearing was a huge, female Snorlax. No, not huge, more like titanic. Standing at a staggering 8’1 feet tall, a height very uncommon among her kind, each footfall made by the mammoth sized Pokémon made your entire world vibrate and shake lightly with each giant step her staggering 1,500 pounds of blubbery bulk took.

While many Snorlaxs were known for their huge bellies and huge appetites, it was clear to you that her weight settled in other areas. Gigantic N-cup sized breasts exploded out of her upper chest, with a massive ass that jutted out of her form like two yoga balls covered in blue fur.

"What's a sweet little thing like yourself doing out here all alone?~" The Snorlax calls to you, with an alarmingly seductive tone to her voice. Your first instinct was too run away from her as soon as she spotted you, but you found your feet glued to the ground as the Snorlax kept closing the gap between the two of you. Now that you and the Snorlax were essentially face to face, you barely registered the immense size difference between the two of you. Just to look eye to eye, the Snorlax had to bend over while also at the same time giving you a very personal view of her cleavage, the two large orbs gently smooshing against the grassy ground and nearly brushing up against you.

It was at this point that you also remembered that she was talking to you, and probably wanted a response. There were so many questions in your head, who was she, why was she here? Despite all this, the only thing you managed to utter was, "uh...H-Hi?" You also managed to wave your arm about, as to accentuate your greeting. The Snorlax let out a giggle, which if you were honest with yourself, was pretty cute It also caused her...well everything to jiggle as well, there was no denying it, this woman was huge both in height and weight. You thank your lucky stars that she appeared to be friendly, her hips alone were so wide that if she were to sit on you, no one would even see you. You shudder thinking about what else this behemoth of a woman could do to you.

As if she were sensing your thoughts, The Pokemon tried to soothe your mind. "Don't worry hun, I wouldn't hurt a cutie like you." The Snorlax cooed, "say, what's your name sweetie?"

Feet still frozen in place, you try your best to respond to the massive Pokemon "I..um" You blushed. "I don't really have...a name. My parents always just called me son...i guess my name is just Eevee."

"No name?" The Snorlax tilted her head. "Well, that's not right. A lovely man like yourself should have a lovely name to go with you."

You couldn't help but blush at her complement, so far things were going great between the two of you...hey...maybe you could ask her wear your Parents are! You wondered if she was really being honest with you, for all the smiling and giggling, she could be hiding an ulterior motive. But she wouldn't do that! She's too nice for that, or so you hoped.

"Have you...have you seen a Leafeon and Espeon around here?" You ask, finally working up the courage to do so.

"Mmmm...can't say I have sweetie.~" The snorlax replies almost cheerfully. "Why, do you know 'em?"

"Well...the thing is..."

--Time Passes--

“You Parents never came home?!” went the gigantic Snorlax in a shocked tone, after you delivered the news to her. “There, there sweetie…it’s alright” she said genuinely sympathetically. That poor little baby! How could they just abandon their child? She was so precious! The Snorlax stroked you on the head lovingly and soothingly. "You'll find them soon. Don’t feel bad, now. I'll help you look for them." she said sweetly.

Your jaw dropped in shock as the Snorlax uttered that last sentence. "Y-y-your gonna help me?" You asked. "Why? W-we only just met, were strangers!"

"Oh, i don't believe in strangers, just friends and family that i haven't met yet."

The corner of your mouth turned up in a grin.

"Although..." The hyper fat, voluptuous Snorlax stood back up at full height, reminding you of how small you were compared to her. "Before i do..." she turned her gaze towards the berry bush in the middle of the small clearing the two of you were occupying. "...well, can't work on an empty stomach!"



Half an hour later, the berry bush, as well as four other fruit bearing trees around the area, was picked clean by the massive Snorlax, leaves and all. You heard the stories that your father would tell of how Snorlaxs would eaten anything even remotely edible, but you never thought he was telling the truth until today. You were perched on top of the Snorlax's belly as she laid down on her back to digest, stroking the now even more massive gut of your very big, very satisfied temporary guardian.

“BUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!!!!!” went the Snorlax letting out a massive belch, her gigantic breasts resting heavily atop her bloated belly.

She smiled down at you, your head resting against one of her enormous boobs, stroking her fat belly the same way your mother stroked your fur before you went to bed. "Feeling full, Ms. Snorlax?" You asked eagerly, ready to start the search for your parents. Although you did not deny you were pretty comfy where you were right then.

“A little bit” grinned the Snorlax, looking past her overflowing cleavage and humongous stomach at the four emptied, bare trees around her. "But I could go for seconds."

Without warning, you began to laugh. Good Arceus does this women have an appetite! If she kept eating like this, she’d be even bigger then she is now!

"Maybe later."
1522.title: ...a Snorlax suddenly blocks the path

choices: ...You began to ask the Kangaskhan some questions
...A group of Pokemon suddenly cornered around you
15221.content:
In the past, the forest was savage and untamed. Predators ruled the wilderness, and everybody fought for themselves. Only the strongest survived. All of that changed when the village of Lake Church was established. Lake Church was originally thought of as a watering hole, where predators and prey, friends and enemies, could all come to be in harmony, and help each other through the toughest winters. Eventually, a sense of community bloomed from the plaza, and spread through the entire forest. Now, everybody knows everybody else, and everybody tries to help one another and live in peace.

You had never been here. Your parents told you about, but they never let you lave the tree. They always said that the world was always looking for ways to take advantage of you, even if it was disguised with civilized behavior and niceness. You felt so out of place here, like a visitor from a different world. You were a wild Eevee raised in a tree, this was a town!

"What is the place, Ms. Snorlax?" You asked the behemoth women. She was carrying you atop her left shoulder as she strolled into the town. To your surprise, none of the locals seemed to be surprised by the sight of her. Sure, there were some sideways glances and the occasional reaction to the ground shaking, but other then that, everyone seemed to ignore the big Pokemon.

"This is the village of Lake Church, little sweetie." The Snorlax answered, although you could tell a little less cheerily then before. The plaza was built up from an empty field by the forest’s largest lake. The buildings were mostly big wooden structures, painted to resemble various Pokemon. "If i'm being honest handsome, I kinda hate it here."

"Huh? Why?"

"All these Pokemon of all kinds with big smiles on their faces, content with their boring, peaceful lives…I don't understand them at all. Every time I pass through this place, I always see Pokemon dancing, singing, and being merry, as if every day they lived was cause for celebration".

You were taken back in surprise. This response was so out of character for the seemingly nice Snorlax. You were beginning to wonder weather or not this was the same Snorlax that agreed to help you find your parents. "What's wrong with Pokemon being happy?"

"Oh, there's nothing wrong with it at all.~" The Snorlax licked her lips stealthily over some of the pedestrians walking around. "It's just so...unnatural. Friends and helping people is nice and all, but when it comes down to the itty bitty bits, were all just wild Pokemon on the inside. And the golden rule for the wild is..."

"...It's eat or be eaten."

You felt a shiver go down your spine as she said that. So the Snorlax DID have a darkside. Although...at least she was well in control of it. Against, your better judgement, you still felt safe around her. She still caries an aura of warmth and kindness, even if she wasn't above eating people. A particular smell caught your attention, however. Looking through the street, you see a curiously Kangaskhan shaped building with big red letters that spelled "CAFE" on a white square sign.

"M-maybe we could go to the Cafe to ask some questions over there." You politely suggested. To your surprise, you found that the Snorlax was already walking over towards the building. "Oh, of course handsome." She kicked your face with her fat, pink tongue. You blushed involuntarily as you wiped some saliva off your fur. "Right after a little snack."

You stifled a sigh as she said the lats part. You were going to have to get used to the Snorlax's appetite. It was expected of her, yes, but it was still kind off annoying that you were going to have all these breaks in between your search for your parents.

“Oh! Hey, honey,” the kangaskhan smiled as the Snorlax sat down an especially wide chair that seemed to be made just for her. It creaked under her weight, but by some force of Arceus or black magic, it stayed up. "Oh, and who's this little cutie?" She said as she eyed you sitting on her shoulder.

"H-h-hi..." you introduced yourself.

"This is Eevee. I found the poor little thing all alone in the forest. He got separated from his parents and we're here in town to to find some leads about where they might be."

"Oh, you poor thing!" The Kangaskhan gasped, looking aghast. You didn't understand why your parent awareness you about other Pokemon. So far everyone was acting awfully nice to you. "How have you been holding up?”

“It’s been… hard,” you frown. “But I’ve been staying together.”

“Good, good. Well, I bet a belly full of mama’s delicious home cooking would really cheer you up,” the kangaskhan smiled. “And for you?" She gestured to the Snorlax "Everything’s on the house. Eat all you want!”

“N'awwww! Thanks, kangaskhan,” The Snorlax grinned. She had been preparing to just pay for it, but this all-you-can eat arrangement serves her just fine. "You do know I'm gonna eat evreything, right?"

"Oh, of course." The kangaskhan nodded. "But, I can afford one bad day. Besides, I owe you for saving my baby last month. If it wasn't for you, he would've been pudge on that Charizard right about now." The kindly chef brings out a small plate of food fro you to chow down on. You realize that you have;t had any breakfast yet. You would have had some of those berries earlier, but...

You hop down from the Snorlax's shoulder gracefully and began to chow down eagerly on the food, uttering a rushed thank you between gulps. She smiles as you chow down on the delicious food. The Snorlax began to devour on berry salads and apricorn stews, the food practically flying down her throat. Every bite she took only seemed to make her hungrier, bu the patrons were actually pretty blaze about the whole thing as she swallowed multiple full meals in seconds. Her throat could stretch wide with ease, her powerful stomach able to easily handle the feast she was loading it with.

Before the Snorlax could run through the Cafe's entire daily stock...

153.content:
You're a short Pokémon with a white, thin body, fur that makes it look like you're wearing a gown, and green hair covering your upper face like a bowl. Your parents were a Gardevoir, and a Gallade. You all had strong minds, which enabled you each to perform amazing feats with your mind. Soon, you grew strong enough to communicate with your parents telepathically. Though, they usually had to be within several meters of you for you to sense. They never left your field when they collected berries, but now you couldn't sense them anywhere. They told you they would never go anywhere you wouldn't sense them, so you knew something happened to them.

You tried to remember where they usually visited to get berries, so maybe if you visited one of those areas, you could find some sort of clues. You remembered that they went the mouth of some cave northwards, at the beginning of a mountain trail, and deeper into the nearby jungle. Your parents told you all about how scary the outside world was, and you doubt you'd ever see the world as anything other than a ravenous land of death. But you felt you had to go out and find them. Something could've happened to them, after all.

You used your psychic powers to float from the tree to the grassy ground. You couldn't levitate all the time, so you had to be more conservative. You already began to feel a headache form. Now, you needed to decide which way your parents left.

1532.content:
You began walking to the mountain trail. As you walked, you realized that there weren't really any Pokémon on the path. Maybe this is why they'd visit this bush. Before too long, you reached the bush. You saw a few berries plucked from it and discarded at the foot of the bush. You tapped into your psychic powers, and felt a strong familial presence on it. Your parents must've been close to this recently. The area around the bush seemed safe, so the next place you figured they could've been taken to was up the trail. And thus, the hike began.

As you traveled up it, you began to feel a little cold. The top of the mountain was covered in snow. You shivered and felt the gown-like extension of your fur dragging on the snow. You tried to sense them, but there was some presence messing with your abilities. It's like there are too many ghosts nearby, interfering with your sensing powers. You had to do this manually. As you traveled, you began to hear a soft singing on a snowy trail shooting off of your current trail.

It sounded nice, almost like your mother. However, you had no way of knowing if it was safe or not. You've heard your parents mention about something called a Froslass, a ghostly Pokémon hanging out in the snow that likes to lure their victims, freeze them, and then take them home to do whatever they wanted to them. You feared that the singing belonged to one of those, but it might be one of your only leads for a while. Then again, you could keep going up the trail, or to a forest down a different fork in the path.
1532.title: Go to the mountain

choices: You used a psychic attack on her
15321.content:
Your parents warned you about going towards any mysterious signing. Especially in the nearby mountain. However, it sounded nice. More importantly, it began to sound less mysterious, and more like your mom. Maybe your fear made you mistake the singing for someone you didn't recognize. It's probably your only chance of finding your parents.

You trekked through the snow, your arms wrapped round yourself to try and keep warm. As you kept walking, the sound of your mother's song sounded like it was surrounding you, yet you could tell which way it was coming from. It almost felt like her song was trying to hug you. It felt nice and, sorta warm. Maybe you were wrong to think they were in trouble. Maybe they found some better food higher up the mountain. Eventually, you began to see a faint outline of someone.

They were hard to see, being all white against the snow, but you could definitely see something floating before you. In fact, they seemed to be approaching you. They looked sorta like a skull with a long, ghostly tail and two thin arms. Around the tail, you saw what looked like a red ribbon. Under the skull-like head, you saw purple flesh and cyan eyes with yellow sclera. You now realized you've been tricked as the strange Pokémon stops signing. She must've been a Froslass.

She floated towards you, her tai and flaps on her arms flowing elegantly as she moved. You also noticed that she moved frighteningly fast. You held up your arms in front of you, fearful, to try and block whatever attack was incoming. However, instead she flew around you and right behind you in the blink of an eye. Her speed whipped up specks of snow with her speed, creating a thin fog.

"I haven't seen your kind around here," she said. "What brings you up hear?"

"I-I'm just looking for my parents," you said while leaping away from her. "I must've made a wrong move, so I'll just head out."

"But it's so cold up here, you won't survive," she said. "I've set up a shelter nearby, I can keep you there. Then I'll find your parents, and bring them back to you." As she spoke, she floated towards you more, and you backed away. Unfortunately, you were being moved away from the mountain trail.

"Nah, I'll be fine. I just need to get back to the trail, so if you could just move aside-" you started.

"Nonsense! I just want to help you out," she said. She then held out a hand, and beckoned for you to grab it. "Just take my hand, and I'll bring you to my shelter."
15321.title: Go to the signing

1551.content:
You both were lucky. Most other Pokémon in your position would be all alone to face the whole, scary world. Luckily, you both had each other. One Plusle, and one Minum. Your parents told you two to stay together, and you never understood why for a while. Your parents, however, knew about how the both of you could improve your powers if you were in close proximity. You never had to fight anyone, so you never realized it. Now that your parents went missing, you may have to rely on each other a little more than usual.

You both looked down from the tree, shaking at the thought of being without your parents. They disappeared for quite a while, they usually came back with food by now. You both looked at each other, silently asking the obvious question. Should we look for them? After plenty of silent deliberation, you both agreed that the best course of action was to get down and search for them, while keeping your parents' words in mind. You both leapt down with extreme agility, and eventually made it to the ground.

On the ground, you felt a familiar essence. Your parents displayed positive and negative charges, just like the two of you. On the ground, you could feel their charges, a steady trail of positive and negative charges. You were positive that this could lead you to your parents, but you felt negative that it meant you may be facing the strange and scary world around you. Your parents always warned you against leaving the tree because the world around you both was full of mean, hungry, and evil Pokémon that'd try to snatch you up.

You just had to make sure you kept away from others, and find your parents, ASAP. The trail led you...

The two of you faced each other, and nodded, recognizing that you had to do this fast. You both held each other's hands, and ran forth, following the charges. You could swear you heard something nearby.

Eventually...
