“T-then give me something!” She begged. With a belly like this, she definitely couldn’t reach her pussy with her own paws, so it seemed she needed some outside help.

“O-okay!” You agreed, looking around. Most of the stuff in the hallway seemed to be bolted down… except for one of those weird statues that seem to be scattered around the monastery. You were unsure whether or not she would be comfortable using that, since she seemed to like prayed to these statues a lot… but sure enough, the second you pushed it up behind her, she sat down on it without hesitation, her weight plunging the statue most of the way into her sex in an instant.

“Fuck...!” Wasn’t as big as she’d have liked, but it would do. It was difficult to do anything given her added weight, but through sheer dedication alone, she managed to slowly bounce up and down on the de facto dildo as she rubbed eagerly over her sensitive belly. Her eyes were squeezed tensely shut as she concentrated on her prey… before she suddenly slid them opep, and you found yourself staring into her beautiful golden eyes. “R-r-rub… ruub…” She gestured to her belly, and you realized what she was asking, obediently sitting down in front of her and tentatively sending your paws over her stomach. You almost shiver when you realize you could feel the movements of the luxray inside. “Ohh… keep squirming all you want…” she whispered to the luxray inside of her. “Y-you’re gonna stay on my ass… forever…”

You weren’t entirely sure what to do with your own manhood, which was still rigid and burning in anticipation, but eventually, the persian decided to take care of that for you. You almost yelped in surprise when she leaned back, wrapping her hind paws around your shaft on both sides. You were about to pull away on instinct, but as she started stroking her paws up and down, you realized it it actually felt… kind of amazing. It helped that this was the first time anybody had been so… intimate with you. As you leaned into her soft belly, listening to the protests of the luxray inside as you rubbed with increasing fervor in an attempt to return the favor, you realized how incredibly surreal this whole situation was. Before, she seemed like the pinnacle of humility and class. The second she had gotten the taste of that luxray, though, it was like she had become an entirely different person. Now, you were watching her rub her bulging belly with one set of paws while giving you a footjob with the other, all while sitting on one of her own sacred idols. For a moment, you wondered if you were dreaming.

You’d become quite well-acquainted with your own paws, but feeling someone else’s wrapped around your dick was incredible in comparison. This, combined with the feeling of the persian’s distended belly and the sound of her delighted moans, it didn’t take too long for you to finally get the release you craved. Your orgasm almost took you by surprise, not giving you enough time to even warm her before you sprayed cum all over her paws and belly. You gasped as you collapsed against her belly, using it like a pillow as you emptied your balls all over her fur. She was too distracted to even notice; at this point, she seemed to have checked out from reality completely, too overwhelmed by the feeling of the luxray inside her. You knew now what she meant by ‘sinful urges’. Just as you pulled away from her, you heard the braviary’s voice ringing from down the hall. “Hello? Any survivors back here?"

The persian ignores the voice completely, lost in her own little world. You, on the other hand, were suddenly reminded of the violent battle that had just taken place. “I-I should go get help,” you say, cleaning up as best as you possibly can (not very well) before rushing down the hall. “I’ll be right back!”
155222211111111211.title: It's Probably Karma

1552222111111112111.content:
You return to find the once beautiful main room a brutal wreckage of debris. Books and broken idols littered the floor, and sunlight poured in through massive holes in the roof and walls. Within, the remaining members licked their wounds and regrouped after their relentless battle. You noticed Alda, the braviary, first and foremost, leaning against a wall as she had her wounds bandaged by the other Sisters. Of all the survivors, it looked like she had battled the fiercest. The braviary seemed to be the only one standing in the way of that huge scolipede, so it was probably thanks to her that any of you survived. “Are you okay?” You asked her.

She smiled warmly when she saw you. “Yes, I am quite alright,” she replied, “thanks to your friend.”

“What do you mean?”

“Just as the bandits were about to take the monastery, the ninetales appeared to help ward them off,” she explained. “I have to say, I was impressed by her competence. She was relentless in battle.”

“Really?” You said. You were proud of the ninetales, but something about the braviary’s tone worried you. “What happened to her?”

She sighed, staring at the ground. “Unfortunately, she grew too foolhardy, and eventually she was… captured,” she confessed. “The moment they captured her, the bandits immediately cut their losses and left. I presume she is what they came for, yes?” Damn it! You came back too late! If you hadn’t been busy getting pawed off in a back room, you might’ve been able to save her. You sat there, pondering the situation. Good news -- it turns out the ninetales hadn’t abandoned you after all. Bad news -- she was captured. Possibly dead. Probably trapped inside that scolipede’s big, round belly at this very instant, being ‘escorted’ to their headquarters in Shipton city. If they were smart, Marden’s thugs were long gone by now. You didn’t know exactly how large this city was, but from the sound of it, it would take far too long to find her yourself. You had to have a lead…

“Yes, she is,” you nod. “I’m… so sorry. When I came here, I didn’t expect… all this would happen…”

“Don’t say that. Regardless of what they were here for, none of this is your fault,” The braviary leaned back sagely. “This is probably Marden’s doing. I told Elmira he shouldn’t let him have the run of the place,” she said, looking sadly over the ruins of the monastery. “Now… look at us. We are but humble worshippers. We don’t take tithes or donations… how will we ever afford to repair this damage?” She gestured to the holes in the structure with a wing. “That’s not even mentioning the Sisters we’ve lost… though their souls are at peace with Cresselia, now…”

“Who is… Elmira?”

“Oh, yes. You are wild, aren’t you?” She remembered. “Elmira is a delphox, and the mayor of Shipton city. Though, depending on who you ask, Marden is the one who really runs the place…”

“So… could she help?”

“Yes, go. Tell Elmira what happened here,” she nodded. “She was very supportive of our monastery, in the early days. If she’s still anything like she used to be, I’m sure she will be disheartened to hear of the atrocities that have occurred here. Perhaps it will finally spur her to take some action…”

Your heart leaped in your chest. This was the perfect lead! “Yes, I-I’ll get right to it. Thanks!” You said, just about to leave to rush to Shipton, before you remembered something. You pointed down the hall you just emerged from. “Oh, yeah, uh… Sister Silvia is still in the back. She might need some help.”

“What happened?”

“One of the raiders… attacked me, and she sort of… ate him,” you explained, sheepishly, recalling all that had happened. “Now, she can’t move.”

“Is that so?” She raised a 'brow'. “Well, I should… speak with her, then.” You froze up at her tone, suddenly feeling like you had just told the braviary something you shouldn’t have. You watched as she stood up, brushing her subjects aside as she walked dutifully down that darkened hall, despite her injuries. “So long, absol.” You stood there, conflicted. Of course, none of this was any of your business, but… you needed to make sure that you didn’t land the persian in too much trouble. After she literally saved your ass, you felt like you owed her that much. When none of the other Sisters was looking, you crept down the hallway behind the braviary.

You were lost in the dark for a while, until you heard the persian crying from down the hall. From the sound of it, she was back to her old self again. “Miss, you don’t understand…” You hear her sob. “He was… he was going to…” You immediately used all the knowledge you had learned from the ninetales to hide silently around a corner, lifting an ear to eavesdrop on their conversation.

“You could’ve just incapacitated him, like you’ve been taught,” you hear the braviary calm but stern voice reply. “And not only that, but to… desecrate one of our idols? What is your justification for that?” The persian could only whimper in response, knowing she’s been beat. You peek around the corner, only to see the persian still laying there on his huge belly, still completely immobilized by the squirming luxray. She was crying, now, as Alda loomed over here. The braviary pauses for a while, as she decides on a punishment for the persian. “If you do not respect our methods, you do not belong within our ranks. Henceforth, you shall be placed under exile from this monastery.”

“E-exile…?” The persian looked up at her, shocked. This is the only home she’s ever known. “M-miss…”

“Hm?” The braviary tilted her head. “Do you not agree that you deserve such a punishment? We’ve already given you a second chance.”

The persian bit her lip, clenching her eyes shut as if that could stop the tears. She knows that this is what she deserves. “N-no…” she admits, defeated. “I understand…”

“Good, then. I hope you find peace in your future dealings,” the braviary says curtly, wrapping things up. “One of the Sisters will have to escort you to town, now, since you seem incapable of moving on your own.”

“I could take her!” You insisted instinctively, stepping out of your hiding place, so desperate to do something to help. The two of them looked at you, surprised, and you backed up sheepishly, remembering that you weren’t supposed to be eavesdropping. “I-I mean… I’m going to Shipton city, anyway… maybe she could help me find my way around?”

The braviary stares at you for a while, her expression unreadable, before shrugging. “Very well,” the braviary says curtly, wrapping things up. “Given her… immobile state, I will provide a cart to carry her around with on the way to town. Consider this my parting gift.”

You were relieved as the huge bird walked away, having agreed to your offer, until you were confused by something. “... a cart?”
1552222111111112111.title: Should I Stay or Should I Go?

15522221111111121111.content:
“No, really… I don’t deserve all the help you’ve given me…”

A harness was tied around your body, attached to a big wooden cart which trailed behind you   as you wandered down the forest path. The persian laid miserable and immobile in the cart, her belly big and round enough to take up the entire compartment, getting squeezed slightly by the sides. She certainly wasn't wearing her robes anymore -- they would it fit on her anyway -- but she still had that odd black veil still obscuring half her face. Now, the veil had the added effect of hiding the persian’s shame and humiliation. It was a little difficult to pull the weight of both Pokemon on a cart for all these miles, but it was definitely good exercise. “Nonsense. I’m glad to help out,” you smiled, looking over your shoulder. “Besides, you saved me.”

She continued, seemingly ignoring you completely. “I’m… so, so sorry for… everything that happened back there,” she said, crying openly for the fifth time over the course of this trip. “Sometimes, when I’m… overcome by my urges, I become… someone else.” She held her head in her paws, trying to control her tears. “I was… weak…”

“I mean, I thought you did a pretty good thing,” you shrugged, not understanding what she was so upset about. “After all, did you see what he was about to do? I’d say he had it coming.”

“Maybe you do… but it’s not up to us to judge the value of the lives of others,” she whimpered, sadly. “Members of the order of Cresselia are supposed to be strictly nonviolent, at all costs.”

“Well, you’re not in the order of Cresselia anymore,” you reply, trying to make her see reason. “So… you don’t really have to worry about all those rules now. Just know you did the right thing.” You look into her eyes, sadly admitting, “Besides… it was sort of my fault you got kicked out, anyway.”

“What? Don’t say that!” She suddenly insists, as if shocked you would even say such a thing. “My weakness is my responsibility, and mine alone!”

“Sheesh, okay, okay,” you roll your eyes, before glancing at her belly, which was just ever so slightly larger than she was. You had never seen anyone so full before. It was still… quite exciting, to be honest. “How is he in there? Still movin’?”

“Yes, he is still moving. He’ll be moving in there all day, that I know for certain,” she says, as if this much was obvious. You hoped she’d let you rub her belly again today, though this didn’t seem like the proper time to ask.

“So, according to you… isn’t he going to, like…?”

“Yes, according to Cresselia, he will become a part of me,” she sighs. “His soul will remain within my body until the day of my death… which will hopefully be soon.”

You flinched when she said that, but ultimately, you had no idea how to respond, so you just kept quiet. A couple minutes later, by coincidence, the towering skyscrapers of Shipton city peeked over the horizon. “Town’s coming up.”

“Greeaat,” she frowns, obviously not overly enthusiastic. For someone who tries to be as humble and unassuming as her, being seen like… this was probably going to be beyond humiliating. Still, there was no time to worry about that now. You hurried down the mountain trail, trying to make it to Shipton city as soon as possible. Every minute you waited was another minute that could’ve been spent searching for the ninetales!

When you finally reached the city, you were in awe. There were more Pokemon walking up and down a single stretch of road than you had every seen before in your life. Some of the buildings stretched so high they touched the sky. Beautiful neon lights and feats of art-deco architecture stretched as far as the eye could see, making you feel positively tiny compared its grandeur. Just looking at it from a nearby hill, one thought struck your mind… how were you ever going to find the ninetales in all of this? You didn’t even know where to start. “What… what are we going to do?” You whispered to the persian, who you assumed would have more experience with this than you.

“Find a hotel, first off,” she replies. “I’d… really rather not be seen like this for too long.”

“How do we find a… ‘hotel’?” You’d never heard the term before.

She shrugs. “Ask somebody for directions.”

You brace yourself, before finally wandering down the hill into the expansive city. The citizens of the city were all well-groomed, wearing fancy accessories, and seemed shocked by the sight of two wild Pokemon walking in; especially when one has a massive, bulging belly, and the other’s carrying them around in a cart. Everyone stopped to stare as you passed by, with expression ranging from shocked to amused. The persian hid her face with her paws, humiliated beyond belief. She wished she could just… melt away, right here and now. Meanwhile, you were distracted by the amazing sights of the city, but still preoccupied with finding a hotel. You definitely wouldn’t fit in with any of the city’s fancier citizens, so you decided to try and find another wild Pokemon like yourself. Maybe they’d be willing to give you directions. Eventually, you come across a suitably wild...
15522221111111121111.title: Finally in Shipton City

155222211111111211111.content:
The mienshao looked just as out-of-place around here as you did. She had a purple bandana wrapped around her forehead, and her cheeks were covered in dirt -- more notably, she had that wild, bemused look in her eyes that was distinct from the disingenuous posturing put off by most of the locals. “Excuse me? Miss?”

The mienshao turned to you, looking you in the eyes for only a moment before she was inevitably distracted by your friend. Unlike the more civilized Pokemon, instead of being disturbed the persian’s huge gut, she only appeared amused. “Pffft hahaha!” She said, covering her mouth with one of her long arms. “Bit off a little more than you could chew there, huh? Do you need help with that?” The persian stared at the ground in silence, humiliated.

“No, actually…” You said, stepping in. “We’re, uh, new to this town. And… civilization in general really.”

“... and you can’t make heads or tails of this place, can you? I get it. This dump’s pretty complex,” she smirks. “Well, I could certainly guide a lovely couple like yourselves around! Not like I have anything better to do tonight…” You’re a bit surprised when she refers to as a couple, but you don’t bother to correct her. The mienshao pauses, looking over the cityscape with a cynical eye. You could tell she didn’t like this place much. “Well, this district’s only good for buying incense and getting caught up in gang fights.” She points towards the other end of the city, which shined so bright it lit up the evening sky even from miles away. “See all that? The flashing lights, the big smiles, the all-you-can-eat buffets? Only part of the city that doesn’t look miserable? Yeah, you can’t go in there.”

“Why not?”

“There are two types of Pokemon in this world -- wild, and civilized. You’re wild,” she says bitterly, poking you in the chest, “and the ‘civilized’ Pokemon sure as hell don’t want wild Pokemon stinking up their little paradise.” Finished with whatever she was doing, the Mienshao starts trotting gracefully down the road, and you decide it’s in your best interest to follow her. “You can technically enter if you want, but don’t be surprised if you get eaten. Not like it’s much safer around here. Marden’s turf is full of thugs trying to prove themselves. If they get their paws on you, just getting eaten is considered a mercy.” Apparently, Shipton city wasn’t all it was cracked up to be. “Seriously. Whatever business you have here, you want to get it done quick. There’s a fuckin’ civil war brewing between Marden and the civilized districts, and you don’t want to be here when shit hits the fan.”

You were a bit taken aback by her spiel… but you tried to focus on what you came here for. “So… where’s the mayor?”

The Mienshao raises a brow. “Elmira? Y’see the building with the big, sharp roof over there? That’s where her office is,” she points towards a big, fancy building that towered even over the other structures in the city. “Don’t count on her to be very helpful, though. She’s Marden’s bitch. Literally; I’ve heard he’s rutted her a few times just to show her who’s boss.”

You were a bit confused by all the information the Mienshao was dumping on you. If the mayor really was following Marden’s orders, you’d have to be careful. Perhaps your meeting with Elmira could be postponed till tomorrow. “Oh, uh…” You say, considering your other priorities. “Well, is there anywhere around here we can stay for the night?”

“Depends. What's your budget?”

You blinked, uncomprehending. “... budget?”

She stops in her tracks. “... ugh. You really are wild, aren’t you?” She sighs, turning towards the two of you, looking a little annoyed. “Listen. You two seem, like… moderately trustworthy. I mean, obviously your girlfriend here’s obviously a bit of a glutton, but she seems like she’ll be ‘incapacitated’ for a while, and you don’t look like you’d hurt a fly.” She rubbed her chin with one of her long, skinny arms contemplatively. “So, I’ll tell you what. You can sleep in my apartment for tonight while you’re figuring shit out. Don’t need any money or anything — though I might end up asking for a few favors.”

You were so surprised and delighted by her offer, you didn’t stop for even a moment to contemplate any of the implications. “Y-yeah, sounds great! Thank you!” You almost shouted, nodding eagerly with a big smile on your face.

“Right this way, then,” she gestured with a knowing smirk, as she walked the city streets once again.

You trailed along behind the mienshao, struggling to drag the wagon behind you. It felt like you were travelling for miles, and soon your legs ached from the increased weight. You look over your shoulder at the persian for a moment, only to notice she looks absolutely miserable. To be paraded around town like this is probably the last thing she needs during her darkest moment. As you think back on the events that led to all this, you started feeling a little bad yourself. You definitely could’ve handled things better. “Y’know… I’m sorry for what I did, back at the monastery,” you apologized to her, so softly only she could hear.

“What do you mean?” She whispered back, lifting her head, temporarily distracted from her misery.

“If you really weren’t in your right mind…” You frowned. “In retrospect, I might’ve… taken advantage of the situation…”

She looks confused for a moment, before realizing what you were referring to. “What? You mean the pawjob? Honestly, that’s the least of my worries,” she said, incredibly nonchalantly. “Honestly, I would’ve just pawed you off the night before if you had asked. I was your host, after all.”

“W-what!?” You almost froze in place, surprised to hear the eloquent persian say something so vulgar. “But weren’t you, like… a nun?”

“We practiced humility and chastity, yes, but not abstinence,” she rolls her eyes. “In fact, instead of monogamy, Cresselia advocated for open and honest love. All members of the monastery were open and intimate with one another, and with outsiders on occasion. It’s just a part of life.” Perhaps you were just sheltered, but you had no idea how so many Pokemon are so… open about sex. To you, it always felt like something you should be ashamed of; something you should keep hidden away from everyone except the one you trust the most.

Uncomfortable, you try to change the subject. “What about Noviella?”

“Yes, compared to the others, me and Noviella grew… worryingly close,” she frowned. “The abess warned us that devoting ourselves to a single, mortal Pokemon was the path to ruin. We should’ve listened.”

You didn’t like her tone. “I’m… sorry if that reminded you of some… sad memories.”

“Well, like you said. I’m not part of the monastery, anymore. So there’s nothing keeping me from… getting this off my chest,” she says, closing her eyes as if mentally bracing herself to drop some kind of bombshell. "Here’s something I haven’t told a single Pokemon alive; Sister Noviella wasn’t the first Pokemon I devoured.” Your eyes widened a bit. Apparently, her ‘confession’ back at the monastery didn’t tell you the full story. “In fact, Noviella was always fascinated by the fact that I could… ‘consume’ Pokemon. Constantly urged me on. Took… carnal pleasure in it.” She grimaced, obviously wrestling with her guilt. “Started with… feeding me Rattatas. I only agreed to make her happy. I didn’t know how far we’d end up taking it.”

“Of course, the rest of the monastery was none the wiser when wild Pokemon nearby starting disappearing. They didn’t even notice when a few visitors went ‘missing’,” she said, no longer bothering to moderate the volume of her voice. A few local Pokemon gave you weird looks as you passed by. “But… when my predatory instincts kick in, I become a different person entirely. Overcome by… gluttony and debauchery, my mind shuts down until my hunger is… appeased.” Even though she spoke as verbosely and calmly as always, you could feel the palpable emotion behind her voice. “When one of our attempted victims escaped and I was left unsatisfied, Noviella herself fell victim to my… appetite.”

You looked over your shoulder for a moment, and realized the persian’s cheeks were wet with tears. “That’s why it’s important I... control my desires,” she says, sounding stoic as ever. “If I give in... the same thing could happen to you, or some other innocent Pokemon.” The persian shakes her head bitterly. “It’s just not worth it. What authority do I have to consider my pleasure more important than somebody else’s life?”

“I-it’s okay, Silvia. I understand,” you say sadly, trying to calm her down. “Let’s just get to the apartment and let you get some rest. Okay? No need to think about all this right now.” The persian only nodded sadly, her lip quivering as she went back to staring at the ground in front of her once again.
155222211111111211111.title: The Big City

choices: "... feed your girlfriend here to me."
1552222111111112111111.content:
Now you were starting to regret you said anything… not like there was any point in dwelling on it, what with the apartment building finally coming into view. An orange neon sign above the door read Faded Oak. Even from the outside, the big brick building looked run-down and filthy, but it would have to do for the night. You mustered the last of your strength to drag the persian-filled cart up the concrete stairs, and the mienshao smugly slid the door open for you and gestured for you to enter. You didn’t expect much, yet the ancient, worn-down apartment building still managed to disappoint. The tacky wallpaper looked moldy and peeling; the carpet had an ugly floral print, and smelled vaguely of dried piss. Overall, you got the impression that this was a part of town that had just been left to rot.

The second you walked in, following behind the Mienshao, you accidentally bump into the Mightyena who was walking out, colliding face-first with their chest fluff. You stumbled back, clutching your aching snout with a paw. “Oh! Excuse me,” she apologized, before seeing the look on Mienshao’s face, at which point she grinned smugly herself. “Oh, I see. Already managed to lure another poor sucker here, huh?” She walks around your side, sizing you up as she approaches the door. She seems particularly impressed when she finally gets a good look at your rear end, which was admittedly rather pudgy for a non-predator. “Damn, he’s actually pretty cute. I’m impressed. I wouldn’t mind a taste of him myself…” Satisfied, she turns to finish walking out the door, only to come face to face with Silvia. She looked down at the persian’s belly, wide-eyed, as the wooden wagon creaked under its sheer weight “Oh… dear.”

“Y’see? You’ve misjudged me, Luis. I’m just doing my good deed for the day and giving these two poor, wayward outsiders a safe place to stay,” the mienshao mused sarcastically, pinching your cheek. “Though this cutie right here might end up sleeping in the ‘guest bedroom’.”

The mightyena snorted. “Oh, Rana. Truly, you’re a pillar of the community…” She chuckles, before squeezing past the persian and trotting out the door. “Well, good luck, you two!” You stand there, a little confused by that whole exchange. You weren’t stupid — it wasn’t hard to deduce that the mienshao was planning on keeping you in her belly at some point — but the ninetales had done the same thing when you first met, and you had actually quite enjoyed it. Admittedly, you’ve since been longing to be curled up in someone’s belly again, where you don’t have to worry about all the struggles of the outside world… what concerned you, though, was the possibility that the mienshao might be planning to digest you. After having seen so much carnage today, the possibility of digestion was constantly on your mind, and you felt like you couldn’t trust anybody. Still, when the mienshao gestured, you obediently followed; you just decided you would tread carefully.

“Luckily I live on the first floor, so we don’t have to roll your friend here up the stairs…” The mienshao giggles as you pass down the hall. She sticks by your side now, seeming to admire the persian’s belly whenever she got the chance. It was admittedly an impressive sight; Silvia’s stomach was currently bigger than the rest of her entire body, totally immobilizing the miserable persian. It bulged and buckled as the luxray within squirmed in protest, helpless as the persian’s powerful body churned him up into fat. You found it quite enchanting yourself, though out of respect to Silvia, you tried not to stare. Eventually, you crossed by a door that was left ajar; apparently, whoever lived in that apartment didn’t value their privacy. You squinting as you glanced into the dark room, seeing an ampharos sitting at a high-tech setup in their living room, illuminated only by the glow of his multiple screens.

He looked over his shoulder when he heard your wagon pass down the hallway. “Rana! Rana! A moment of your time, please!” He immediately stood up and called upon seeing you, and you freeze in place as the ampharos rushes to the door of his apartment. The mienshao rolled her eyes in frustration upon being noticed.

“Can’t you see I’m busy here?” She grumbles as the excited ampharos faces her.

“This is important! Marden’s planning to finally make a move on the civilized districts!” The ampharos insists. “I’m telling you, I’m onto something here! Something big!”

“Well, it can wait until morning, can’t it? Good,” the mienshao says dismissively, obviously prioritizing getting her rocks off over whatever the ampharos was so concerned about. Before the ampharos could respond, she raised a hand to his lips, silencing him. “If you have to, just use tonight to dig up some more details for me, alright?” The ampharos visibly deflated at being dismissed so easily, the mienshao easily brushing him aside as she continued down the hallway. Eventually, she noticed you staring at her as you walked, waiting for an explanation. “That’s just Issac. He… keeps track of things for us,” she sighs, not wanting to go into detail.

“Us?” You raise a brow.

“Let’s just say Faded Oak has a… specific clientele,” she responds vaguely, a little uncomfortable discussing the topic. Before you can press her for details, she finally stops at a door, labelled 106 in a golden, fancy font. “Enough of that, though. We’re here!” The mienshao sticks her eye up against some weird, high-tec little scanner, and sure enough, the door clicks unlocked. The door slid open, revealing her small, two-bedroom apartment to be… surprisingly nice, actually. Compared to the rest of the building, her apartment was at the very least quite tidy and well-kept, and downright homely compared to your room at the monastery. The mienshao skipped inside and crashed comfortably on the couch as you slowly wheeled in the bloated persian. “Make yourselves at home, you two!” She said, as she flicked the television on, the blaring laugh track of some stupid game show filling the apartment.

As you glance around the apartment, trying to decide what to do next, Silvia whispers in your ear. “I’m sorry, but… I’m beginning to feel sore,” she asked, timidly. “Could you push me off this wagon?”

You had completely forgotten about that! “Oh, yeah, uh, of course,” you nodded, dutifully getting to work gently unloading her from the wagon. Getting her off it was a lot harder then loading her onto it was, though, because now the luxray was squirming around like the devil in there. His every movement made huge bulges in the side of the persian’s fluffy, spherical gut, and he damn near kicked you through the face at one point. “Jeez, he’s really moving around in there now,” you note, exhausted, completely unable to nudge the persian when her prey was struggling with such ferocity.

“Digestion is started to set in,” Silvia sighs solemnly, waiting patiently for you to finish pushing her off, although you were making zero progress.

“Arceus, that’s hot. “N-no!” You cry out, covering your face with your paws, terrified by the knowledge that the martial arts Pokemon could just snap your neck in an instant, if she so desired. “Adriana… I’m her friend!”

She freezes, taken aback by this, her rage subsiding. “What?”

“We were travelling together! I was with her when she got captured!” To your embarrassment, a few tears rolled down your cheeks as you explained yourself, terrified. “I-I want to help!”

She looks down at you, her eyes twitching, as if she’s not sure whether to believe you or to kill you. Eventually, she sighed, deciding that you seemed to be genuine, and climbed off of you. “Is that so?” She stepped back into the apartment, gesturing for you to follow. “Well, I’m going to need every last detail, then.” You shakily pull yourself to your feet, the wind still knocked out of you by the mienshao’s pounce. When you recover, you follow her inside, making sure to close the door behind you.

The two Pokemon stared silently at you, expectantly. Feeling tiny beneath their gaze, you clear your throat and nervously begin to explain yourself. “Me and Adriana… we happened to run into eachother while we were travelling. Hid together from some scolipede,” you explained. “It turned out that we were headed for the same place; Shipton City. So, we just decided… why not travel together?”

“You’re fortunate she didn’t just swallow you. Adriana isn’t usually one to trust random Pokemon,” the ampharos noted. “Did you happen to witness her capture?”

“I didn’t see it myself, but I was there,” you admit. “We were sleeping at the monastery outside Shipton, when it was attacked. She tried to fight back, but she was swallowed up by that same scolipede.” You shivered, sadly recalling the grisly memories. “It’s… it’s all my fault, isn’t it? We never would’ve stopped there if I hadn’t—”

“There’s no time to go feeling sorry for yourself,” the mienshao grumbled. “Just tell us; do you have any idea where they might have taken her?”

“The scolipede traveled towards Shipton. Beyond that, I don’t know,” you confess. The two seem disappointed. “But… I can help you find her! I’m not very good at fighting… but I am pretty good at sneaking around!”

The mienshao stroked her chin. “Hmm…” She muttered, contemplatively. “So… did she tell you what her deal is with Marden?”

“Kind of. They were mates. He was crazy. She escaped. That’s all I know,” you shrug. “She… did show me what happened to her eyes. It wasn’t pretty.”

“She actually took off that blindfold for ya? Shit, maybe she really did trust you…” She raised a brow, looking surprised. “Well, here’s something she might not have told you — before she escaped, she vowed to find a way to carry his cubs. That’s why Marden’s been putting so much effort into finding old mystery machine schematics.”

“Miracle machine?” You ask.

“The MM, uh, bridges the gap between sexually incompatible Pokemon. You don’t need to know the details, they’re actually quite grisly,” the ampharos explains. “The point is, now that his lineage is guaranteed, there’s nothing stopping Marden from making a move on the civilized districts.”

“... what?” You blinked, uncomprehending, feeling hopelessly out of your element.

The mienshao sighed in exasperation, not wanting to keep explaining things to a clueless absol when time is of the essence. “Alright, listen. You want to help, don’t you? Here’s your chance,” she said, obviously at the end of her patience. “We’ve got a guy working undercover in Marden’s territory. I need you to sneak through there, find him, see if he has any intel, and deliver an envelope.” She grabs some paper and quickly scribbles something on it, before stuffing it in an envelope. “You’ll have to meet him in the alleyway between the Figment theater and the BuzBros. Think you can do that?”

“I… don’t even know where Marden’s territory is,” you sheepishly admit.

The mienshao sighed, grabbing another piece of paper and dumping both on your back. “Here’s a map. Now get moving. We don’t have much in the way of time, here,” she demands. You dutifully head for the door, ready to carry out her instructions, but you stop in your tracks when another thought strikes you.

“Uh…” You ask, nervously. “Would you mind if I bring my friend along? Y’know, the persian?”

“Yes, I would mind. You are not, under any circumstance, going to tell a single damn soul about this little errand. Am I clear?” She growls, and you nod obediently. “I’ll take care of the cat while you’re gone, so scram!”

┄┄┄


Your first trip into Marden’s territory was as harrowing as one might expect. Entire blocks of the city seemed to have been converted into a military complex. All around you, you spot menacing thugs of all shapes and sizes, most with their bellies stuffed with screaming, wriggling, digesting Pokemon. There seemed to be some kind of celebration going on, which fortunately made it a little easier to sneak around unnoticed. You couldn’t afford to check your map while sneaking through here, so you’ve memorized the exact location of your destination as best you could. Now, it was simply a matter of making it through this territory without getting spotted. Judging by the bulging guts of many of the Pokemon here, you knew exactly what would happen to you if you’re captured.

The outskirts of his territory are easy to sneak around in, but as you move in deeper, you come to an impasse. There’s an abandoned bar nearby that you know would be an absolutely perfect place to hide in, but you were on the other side of the street from it. You could just trot across the street and hope nobody notices you don’t belong here, but that seems rather risky. On the other hand, you could travel through the network of alleyways… but that had its own risks, as Pokemon seemed to like to retreat to these alleyways for some ‘private time’ with their mates.

You had to choose quickly. What was your next move?
155222211111111211111112211.title: Special Delivery

1552222111111112111111122111.content:
On second thought… Marden’s thugs didn’t seem to have any unifying badges or uniforms. And you doubt the common grunts are going to recognize each and every member. Trying to sneak around would just make you look suspicious, but if you just strutted across the street like you belonged here… what are the odds someone would stop you? After a long period of cowardly hiding, you finally walked up the nerve to step out of the alleyway and start power walking directly towards the abandoned bar. You tried to give off an air of confidence, while on the inside, you were on the verge of having a heart attack. A few Pokemon gave you weird looks as you passed by, but none approached you.

You let out a sigh of relief when you finally walked into the bar, immediately slamming the door shut behind you. You sit there, still sweating and shaking from the adrenaline rush, slowly getting your bearings. Now that you started to take a look around, you couldn’t help but notice this bar was actually quite creepy. Despite the fact that it was in the middle of town, it looked like it’s been abandoned for years, cobwebs in the corners and dust covering every surface. There were a few statues of various Pokemon around, which looked spooky in the darkness.

You try to shake those childish thoughts from your head, placing the map on the ground and unfurling it. The meet-up place you were looking for wasn’t that far away. Just a couple more blocks, and you were home free. Before you could get too excited, though, you heard something; a door upstairs, loudly creaking open. You freeze, holding your breath, suddenly getting a chill. You thought this place was abandoned! Was there somebody here? You strained your ears, but you didn’t hear any footsteps. Your hair stands on end as you stand there for a while, listening.

Just as you were calming down, you suddenly heard a harsh, ghostly whisper from behind you. “What a delicious little morsel…”

You whip around, only to realize there wasn’t anybody there. “W-who said that?” You panic, glancing all around.

You’re frozen in terror as you watch something begin to phase through the nearby wall. As it enters, you recognize its creepy, smiling face; it’s a haunter! “Don’t you know you shouldn’t go sticking your nose in abandoned buildings?” It cackles, floating slowly towards you through the darkness. “They might be… haunted…” With that, it let its huge, spectral tongue slip free from its mouth. Your heart skipped a beat as you’re paralyzed by fear, watching the haunter come to a stop… only for it to suddenly fly towards you!
1552222111111112111111122111.title: Abandoned Bar

15522221111111121111111221112.content:
Your sense of self-preservation overcame your fear, and you immediately ducked under its attack at the last second! Almost by instinct, you began scrambling away from the haunter, rushing down another hallway… only to find yourself face-to-face with a gengar! “Get over here!” He said, leaping forward, his arms stretched out to grab you… only for you to roll out of the way at the last moment. “H-hey!” The gengar called as you continued sprinting down the hall at full speed.

It seemed every hallway you went down, you were attacked by another horror. A chandelure, a cofagrigus, a banette… this bar seemed crammed to the brim with ghosts! Luckily, you manage to just barely dodge each and every one of them, until you finally come across your salvation; a window! Without a moment’s hesitation, you leap headlong through the window, landing in a pile of jagged glass shards. You ignore the pain, get up, and start running down the alleyways, hearing the ghost-types letting out a disappointed sigh behind you. Eventually, you collapsed in exhaustion, adrenaline still rushing through your veins. Whatever’s in this envelope, it better be worth it…


Eventually, you finally come across the alleyway you were looking for. You have an excited grin on your face as you walk in… only to realize the alleyway was completely empty! “Psst. Hello? Is anyone here?” You whispered, afraid you might have ended up in the wrong place. Just as you were about to give up and leave, you noticed a silhouette on a nearby rooftop, looming over you. You squint as you peek up, trying to make out what you were looking at… only for it to suddenly leap down towards you! Before you could even react, you felt the chilling sensation of another Pokemon’s maw wrapping around your head! “Mph!”

You squealed as the stranger landed on top of you, pinning you down against the concrete, instantly silencing you by stuffing your face in their drooling maw. The speed and strength with which they moved was unlike anything you’ve ever seen before. Before you could even scream, they’d already stuffed you a quarter of the way down their throat, your forepaws pressed against your chest as you futilely kick your feet. Darkness surrounds you, as well as the meaty stench of your predator’s previous meals. You didn’t even get a chance to see what was eating you, and already, it had you halfway down its throat!

Your predator gulped you down in just a few more savage, relentless swallows; the entire process of devouring you only having taken a few seconds. Whatever this Pokemon was, they’ve obviously done this many, many times before. You cry and whimper as you’re slowly, forcibly slid into the stranger’s stomach, yelping when you realize you’re up to your chest in acid! You squirm and wriggle against the fleshy walls as the gastric juices tingle and burn at your skin. “P-please! Let me go!” You cry out.

To your surprise, your predator actually responds. “Did Rana send you?” A deep voice responded, sounding oddly nonchalant for someone who’s just devoured you.

Your heart sunk. Was this the Pokemon you were sent to meet? Maybe this was one of Marden’s thugs, who somehow learned you were coming? “... y-yes...” You didn’t know how they would respond to your answer, but it’s not like your situation could get any worse.

“Then you must be my 'payment',” your predator yawned. The belly around you shifts and gurgles as the stranger sits and leans against a nearby wall, rubbing gently over their belly as their acids viciously attack you. Already, some of the fur on your legs was starting to fall out in clumps, and the exposed skin was turning pink.

“Y-your payment?” You whimper.

“Rana sends me delicious little snacks like you as rewards for good intel,” the voice responds. “I was the one who broke the news about Adriana… so I guess she decided to send me a particularly tasty meal today.”

Your heart sinks. “B-but we’re on the same side!” You cried out. “You’re just going to digest me?”

“Sorry, runt. Guess she decided you were expendable.” You were already crying, but at hearing this, you broke down sobbing. What a fool you were, to come to this town. To trust that damn mienshao. Now you were going to die, in the worst way possible, just to add to some random Pokemon’s hips. You curled up and cried as his stomach slowly digested you, giving in to your inevitable fate...

Suddenly, you remember the envelope! “W-wait!” You suddenly yell, perking up. “Rana… she actually sent me to deliver something!”

“Oh? That being?” Your predator asks.

“An envelope! I-I have it right here! I swear!” You plead.

“Alright. Stuff it back up the way you came in,” he replied. Nervously, you stuffed the envelope back up through the tight sphincter to his esophagus, and you could hear your predator loudly coughing it up. He loudly tears open the envelope, before going silent for a while. “... hm. Disappointing.”

Suddenly, you feel your surroundings shake and shift! You gasp, trying desperately to keep your head out of the acid as you’re jostled around in the predator’s gut! “W-what are you doing?” Suddenly, your snout is forced upwards, back through the stretched sphincter! “Mph!” You cringe and whine as the entire consumption process is played out in reverse. His throat muscles clamp painfully tightly around you, pulling you relentlessly back up his tight throat; so tight you couldn’t even breathe, the air crushed from your lungs. Soon though, you finally see daylight again… and before you know it, you’re coughed up, back onto the cold concrete ground.

You lie there limp, dazed, still soaked to the bone in various gastric juices as you slowly regain your bearings. Finally, you laid eyes on your predator, leaning over you; a simple, curvaceous greninja. “W… wha…?” You stutter, disoriented by your speed journey in and out of the greninja’s body. The entire thing only lasted two minutes, and yet, it felt like it had been hours.

“There’s been a change in plans,” the greninja said, tossing the letter aside as you climbed to your feet. You stood there, pathetic and shaking, and yet the greninja spares you no sympathies; in fact, he looks downright bored. He gestures for you to follow before trotting down the alleyway, his wide hips swaying as she walked, no doubt thickened by dozens of previous meals. You were about to follow… but curiosity overwhelms you, and you can’t help but briefly check what the letter had said. It was torn-up and half-digested, but still, you could clearly make out the mienshao’s simple message;

DON’T DIGEST THIS ABSOL, FATASS!!!!! - Rana

1552222111111112111111122112.title: Double Trouble

15522221111111121111111221121.title: Squishy

15522221111111121111112.content:
“W-what?” You gawk, glancing at the persian. “You mean her?”

“Yup,” she said, rubbing the side of the persian’s belly in admiration. “Arceus… with a gut like this, she’ll feel perfect inside me…”

“Are you crazy?” You complained. “Look at her; she wouldn't even fit!”

“Honey, honey… you really don’t know anything about predators, do you?” The mienshao waved a hand dismissively, as if you were the least of her concerns right now. “I’ve been doing this since before you were even born. Trust me; she’ll fit.”

You were perfectly prepared to protest further. After all, you didn’t need to sleep in this apartment tonight; you’d rather sleep on the street then run the risk of your friend being digested! However, before you could say another word, the persian stopped you. “Absol,” she whispers, solemnly. “Just… do as she says.”

You look at her, wide-eyed. “... what?”

“If it means she’ll let you stay here tonight… I accept whatever might happen,” she says, almost begging. “Please. You must understand. With all my sins, any act of penance or atonement I can make… eases my burdens.”

“See? She’s just as eager as I am,” the mienshao smirked. “So go ahead and hop to it, absol.”

You observe the persian as she goes about her nightly duties, beginning with cleaning up the table after the other sisters’ feast. “No, no. They’re helping me,” she frowns. “For the past few years, I’ve been trying to seek penance wherever I can.”

“Why?” You ask, only for her to freeze in place, tensing up at the simple question. “I-If you don’t want to talk about it, that’s fine!” You insisted, taken aback by hear reaction.

She turns to you, the sadness evident in her eyes even through her veil. “No, no. It is my duty to always be honest about the sins I’ve committed, and thereby accept the consequences for them,” she sighs, explaining it as if she’s said it a dozen times before. She closes her eyes and takes a deep breath, mentally preparing herself, before elaborating. “When I first found this order, I was… lost and alone. The prioress, Sister Noviella… she took me under her wing. She gave me purpose. She led me to faith. And over the years, we grew… closer.”

She pauses for a while. “What happened?” You ask, your curiosity burning. Still, she remained silent, as if struggling to force the words from her mouth.

“I… d-devoured her!” She managed to choke out, as if physically expelling the confession from her body. You were stunned. The persian stared at the ground in abject shame as she continued. “Not out of hunger – for pleasure. I had... sinful urges, and in a moment of weakness, I let them overtake me,” she explains, a bit of anger rising in her voice. You could almost feel her self-loathing. “I’ve spent every day of my life trying to atone for… what I did that day. I can only pray that she is able to forgive me.”

“Forgive you?” You ask. You assumed this ‘Noelia’ was long dead, but from the way the persian talked about her, it was as if she was still alive.

“Many scholars of Cresselia believe that when a Pokemon’s physical form is digested, their soul is sealed away as part of their predator’s body, temporarily unable to pass on to whatever afterlife there may be,” she sighs. “Sister Noviello will remain a member of this order, but for the time being she must attend from… well, here.” She gestures shamefully to her own backside with a paw. While it was covered by her veil, you could tell her ass was notably plump compared to the rest of her. “From the look on your face, you must think I’m crazy.”

You suddenly realize you had the most baffled expression. “N-no! I’m just, y’know, I’m curious,” you insisted. Despite how crazy her story was, you sympathized with the persian somehow. “What makes you all believe she’s… a part of you?”

“We have no central doctrine, but disciples of Cresselia can derive great meaning from dreams,” she tilts her head. “In every… case like mine, the spirit of the disciple’s prey has been able to communicate with them through visions and symbols in these dreams.” She finally looks up at you again, her eyes steely. “So, yes. I see Sister Noviella in my dreams whenever I need guidance, and I can feel the warmth of her soul within me, whenever I meditate.”

You take a moment to digest all that information as the two of you walk together. Feeling sorry for her, you insisted on helping the persian with some of her duties; which she seemed uncomfortable with, but was much too polite to say anything. The two of you cleaned up around the monastery for the next hour while the other ‘sisters’ settled in to rest for the night. The process was deathly silent, especially whenever she settled down to pray in front of the strange statues dotting the building. She seemed to be the exactly opposite of the ninetales; courteous, well-mannered and restrained, with a calm and subdued personality. Still, you respected her just as much for some reason. Perhaps the two could balance each other out? “So… what are you, like, praying for?” You break the silence, curious after she’s stopped to pray to a statue for the 3rd time in an hour.

“Oh? Nothing. In her infinite kindness, Cresselia has offered me enough of her blessings for one lifetime. I can get by,” she turns to you. “I was simply expressing my gratitude.”

“... you sure do express your gratitude a lot.”

“We all have much to be thankful for,” she nods, sagely. “Not just Cresselia, but many Pokemon have given us their blessings. Groudon gives us the ground we walk on; Rayquaza gives us the air we breathe. Zekrom gives us peace of body; Cresselia gives us peace of mind.” The persian looks at the ground, sadly. “Those like me, who come to worship Cresselia in particular… need peace of mind in their lives, above all else.” With that, she continued walking, and you hurried after her.

“Well, who do you think I would worship?” You ask. “If I ever get into that sort of thing.”

She gives you a weird look. In retrospect, it was a weird question. “Err… I suppose that depends on what you value in life.” She explained. “Truth? Knowledge? Victory? Music?”

“Oooh, I like music!” You smile, densely.

“Oh, uh… then, you’d like Meloetta, perhaps,” she shrugs. “But ultimately, it’s a question I cannot answer. Deciding what sort of cause you want to dedicate your life to… that requires years of introspection and study.” She gestures to a map on a nearby wall; seemingly just a regular map of the region, with various symbols scrawled all over it with paint. “There are plenty of monasteries across the region you can learn from. Each celebrate a different aspect of life.” She explained while you curiously look over the map. “But I would advise you stay away from followers of, say, giratina or necrozma. They can be a… negative influence.”

As you stare up at the strange map, you find yourself yawning unintentionally. You wanted to stay up and learn more from the persian, but… you’d had a long, active day today. “Very interesting…” You say, turning to her. “Well, I’m gonna call it a day, I think. Thank you for showing me around, really!”

“Thank you for accompanying me,” she smiles through her veil as you trot away. By the time you make it back to the room, stumbling lazily inside, your body was giving up on you. You desperately wanted to get some sleep, but… you were still pretty sweaty after all that exercise today. The bed was pretty cramped, and you didn’t want to gross the ninetales out. Maybe a nice warm, shower would help you relax…

There was a huge pyroar… and she was sprinting straight at you! You froze up like a deer in headlights as she came barrelling towards you, bracing for your inevitable death. To your surprise, however, she just… passed by? You watched the lioness disappeared into the forest once again, not paying you any credence as she passed. Just as relief began to fill you, you heard the stomping of multiple pyroars following after her, kicking up dirt. You watched in awe as an entire pack split around you. They seemed to be hunting, but none of them have taken any interest in you -- not yet, anyway.

“Absol! Three o’clock! On him!” The apparent leader of the hunt shouted, as she, too, just passed you by. Their huge paws threw up dirt as the pack stampeded around you, awing you with their speed and size. Even the smallest of the Pyroars seemed to be almost twice your height, each sporting a big, round, smooth belly which jostled and swung beneath them as they ran. At first, you assumed they were all just pregnant… until you realized every single one of these lionesses had whole Pokemon in their stomachs! All in varying stages of digestion, too; some of their bellies were smaller and still, their prey longed passed, but others’ bellies were still big and bulging visibly as the Pokemon inside struggled futilely against the onslaught of acid. Either way, it didn’t seem to slow them down a bit. Before you even had time to process what you were seeing, one of the pyroars was upon you.

In an instant, you were given a mouthful of dirt as the pyroar at the back of the pack pounced on you, her huge paw pressing your face into the ground. “Got ya!” She laughed cruelly. The other lionesses left her behind, as they continued sprinting through the wilderness, relentless in their hunt for prey. She could easily handle you all on her own, after all; there was nothing you could do to resist as she picked you up by the scruff of your neck, before sprinting back the way she came. You winced and shivered in pain as the lioness’s teeth dug at the soft skin at the back of your neck, forcing you to go limp or risk accidentally breaking your own neck. She certainly knew what she was doing.

She didn’t spare you any comfort on the ‘ride’, didn’t offer you a moment’s consideration. She didn’t even bother to tease you. She seemed to act with almost mechanical efficiency, as if she’s done this hundreds of times before. She ducked and weaved through the forest with incredible ease, carrying you at speeds you’ve never experienced before. It would almost be pleasant, if you weren’t busy considering your inevitable fate. This lioness was one of the ones with a big, full stomach, paw prints making bulges in her furry belly as Arceus-knows what squirms around inside. Was that going to be your fate?

You didn’t seem to have any choice in the matter, now. Before you knew it, the pyroar had returned to the place that seemed to be her home. Adobe huts and strange tarp structures were scattered around a grassy valley; six huts in total, actually, presumably one for each of the lionesses. You hoped she'd let you go right here, but instead, she wandered over to the entrance to a dark, cramped little cave in an alcove a nearby rocky cliff.

“H-hey… let’s be reasonable about this, now,” you whimper as you were plunged into darkness, hearing only the sound of the pyroar’s paws stomping against the cave floor as she walked you deeper into that abyss. “I-if you just let me go, I’ll do whatever you want. I swear. No need to-” Before you could finish your sentence, you were suddenly bathed in light once again. They had set up some sort of prison at the end of the cavern! The chamber was all lit by torches, and filled with large, rusty cages that looked like they had been built by humans long ago. “Whoa.” You said, glancing around the huge, subterranean room. There were about half a dozen Pokemon in various cages already, most curled up, looking weak and miserable. Content, the lioness starts trotting over to one of the empty cages. “Hey! No, no, no! Don’t put me in-”

Once again, you were interrupted, as the lioness swung you by the neck and tossed you, headfirst, into the cold iron kennel. She turned around, kicking it shut with one of her hind legs, the door’s hatch sliding locked automatically. You immediately pressed yourself against the bars, trying to break free. No use -- you were trapped. “See you later, runt!” She padded happily away, her sylphlike body beautifully illuminated by the fires for a few moments, before your captor finally disappeared into the darkness once again.

You trotted around your cage, nervous and dejected, wondering exactly what they had planned for you, here. None of the Pokemon in the other cells seemed to want to talk to you, either, simply ignoring your pleas for answers. Over the next few hours, other lionesses stepped into the chamber intermittently, holding other squirming Pokemon in their maws and locking them up in cages. The freshly-arrived prisoners seemed just as distressed and confused as you were, and unfortunately, you could offer them no answers. After about five hours total, all six lionesses had brought in a Pokemon, ending the day with about a dozen prisoners total. This seemed to be the point that they decided their work was done, and every single one of them crowded into the chamber, celebrating another successful hunt.

One of the pyroars stepped forth to address the prisoners. She was a shiny, it seemed, with beautiful golden, silk-like fur along her perfect boy. From the way the others revered her, she seemed to be the de facto leader of the band. “I’m sure you’re wondering why you’re here,” she said, strutting around the cages, taunting the Pokemon within. You couldn’t help stare at her pudgy rear as she passed you by, imagining the hundreds of Pokemon who must’ve been sacrificed to build her toned, voluptuous body. “Well, your initial suspicions were probably correct. For the next few days, you will all serve us… eventually, as our food.”

Your heart skips a beat as you stare into her beautiful golden eyes. She smiles at your enthusiasm. “But if you please us, we will make your stay as comfortable as we can.” She walked back towards the entrance, nodding to the other lionesses as she slipped into the darkness. “Alright, girls. Do as you will.”

The rest of the pyroars stepped forward eagerly, ready to ‘meet’ the new prisoner. Looks like introductions were in order...

Angry slaps break you away from the thought, vaguely you hear Noelia, ”Sheesh, at least squirm in there! You're not even going down with a fight!” She tries kneading you to get a reaction, at best you whimper and make a few shifting bulges on the outside -- worthless by her standards. She wanted a fighter, and worse still, her body seems used to them.

Noelia, giving up on getting entertainment out of you, looks up to the crowd of cages, ”What a joke, even my guts are tougher than he is. You prey want to know why you shouldn't try and escape? We’ll do this to you.”

Gwrrrbllllll…

Noelia's brown belly begins tightening around your form, near vacuum sealing an outline around you. Her guts try sucking you further towards her stomach -- but as that fails, her bowels become even tighter. Tighter than what should be possible. And your limbs become numb. The numbness seems to expand all across your body until in certain areas, along with systematic pulses from her intestines, it seems to just disappear.

...

Noelia for the first time this night lets loose a purr as her bulging, Absol-stuffed belly transitions from lumpy into soft and malleable. Her bowels bloat with his soft tissue as her guts begin absorbing him directly, the cause of his rapid deformation. He becomes dead weight within her middle, a soft, rolling hill jutting out from her sitting position. Kneading it is like a sponge, except wherever she pushed results in her belly shrinking just a bit more. Wherever she touches allows her villi inside to get a better grasp of the sludge the Absol has become, which quickly absorbs all the nutrients it can.

Right in front of the crowd’s eyes, the Absol is not just swallowed up by Noelia’s ass and digested by the Pyroar’s bowels, but is quickly reforming as bubbly brown fat on the lioness’ sitting rear. Once half the Absol was gone, it was apparent her ass is not just swelling in size, but pushing outwards, becoming increasingly visible from the front. The Pyroar in turn becomes taller thanks to her seated padding, and she starts shifting back and forth, trying out her gorgeous flab. By the time the Absol is barely a noticeable bump on her, she finally stands up and shows off her gains:

Two. Massive. Moons.

Even Noelia is shocked at the amount of chub you had become. Rocking her hips causes her mammoth buttcheeks to cascade into one another. Her thighs are equally infused with your body, squishing like puddy into each other as she flaunts her giant ass around. Her jello-y cheeks easily contain more than half of the Absol’s body, and her thighs and belly jiggle and sway with the rest. With her disaster-cat infused ass, she's worried she’ll lag behind her pride.

”At least this runt knows how to leave a mark. It's like I ate an Arcanine!” Noelia’s tail cutely slaps against her tush, the indent causes a rolling wave of fat on impact.

”And he’s all gone. Not a trace of him left, besides my ass. Even his horn didn't survive.”

”Noelia, if you're up for it…” Salena, seemingly absent towards the end of the ‘show’, comes back with Felecia, two prey in tow.

”Are you up for round 2?”

15531.title: Prey in a different scenario

155311.content:
Every day of your life, you thank your lucky stars you weren’t born a snake.

Seriously, imagine having to constantly wriggle every single inch of your body just to move around. Plus, without any limbs to speak of, the simplest of tasks could prove to be monumental struggle. You used to think snakes were cool, of course… until you met your partner, Zona. Now you just felt sympathy for them. All that slithering around seemed absolutely exhausting for her… especially when she had a huge, misshapen lump in her belly. “Phew… could we, uh, take another break for a second? I’m gonna need a breather…” The serperior panted, weighed down by the contents of her stomach.

“Ugh. Fine…” You groaned, and Zona immediately stopped dead in her tracks, curling up and catching her breath. With a sat, you sat down on a nearby boulder, deciding to use your free time to unfurl your map and review your route. What was supposed to be a quick trek back to town had dragged on far longer than you anticipated, thanks to your partner’s ‘appetite’. “I could have helped you drag that Meganium back to town, y’know, if you hadn’t eaten ‘im.”

“He was a dangerous criminal! He needed to be restrained!” She protested indignantly, as she nursed the painfully distended bulge in her gut.

“He was knocked out!” You roll your eyes.

Your name is Flinch, and together with Zona you’ve formed Team Valor, your standard gold rank rescue team. You’re the leader, and definitely the brains of the operation, with the voracious serperior being the brawn. And when you said voracious, you meant it — being a snake, she can unhinge her jaw on command, and likes to swallow other Pokemon whole whenever she has an excuse. Of course, she’s no killer, always releasing her ‘prey’ unharmed, sooner or later. Still, her habit can be quite annoying sometimes; especially on the occasions where you’re the one getting swallowed, as opposed to some random bandit.

It did have some utility, at least. First and foremost, it allows her to conveniently imprison wanted outlaws inside of her body, so you can ‘escort’ them straight to jail. Take, for example, the unconscious meganium that was currently making a larger-than-usual lump in her belly. He had definitely been a tough bastard; he was a crook and a robber that had terrorized the countryside for years, and when you finally found his hide-out, he had put up quite a fight. He was so big, too, that you had to knock him out just to fit him inside Zola’s belly without it bursting. Even now, the poor serperior was straining to lug his weight around. Still, she seemed to partially enjoy being so full…

Eventually, she gets her bearings, turning her focus back to the task at hand. “Mm… alright, I’m ready. Let’s get this over with,” Zola says, and with that, you’re back to travelling.

┄┄┄


“Thank you two so much! That rapscallion nearly drove us out of business!”

The moment you got back to town, Zola released the half-conscious meganium right in front of the local prison, letting the busy prison workers tie him up and drag the outlaw away. While the two of you were sitting around waiting for the sheriff to give you the bounty’s reward, a cheerful millitank walked up to you, serenading you with gratitude. Apparently, that meganium had stolen from her regularly in the past. “I don’t think I could ever truly repay you. Still, perhaps you’d accept a token of my gratitude…” She offers.

“No reward needed, ma’am. We’re just doin’ our jobs,” you said, holding up a hand. She seemed to be struggling financially enough as it is.

“No, no, no, I insist! Look!” The millitank said, digging through her bags. You were just about to turn her down again when she pulled out a big, ancient-looking key. You stopped dead in your tracks, forgetting whatever it was you were about to say. “I found this big key up in the mountains a few years back. I’ve never found a lock big enough for it… but you probably travel a lot! Maybe you’ll figure it out!” You stare at the artifact wide-eyed as she unceremoniously plops it into your hands.

“T-thank you,” you stutter, immediately hiding the key in your bag. You gesture to Zona as you walk away, obviously in a rush. “C’mon, Zona! Let’s go!”

“But we haven’t collected the bounty yet,” the serperior frowns, though she follows along behind you anyway.

“W-we’ll come back later,” you say, clutching the bag tightly against your chest as you hurry back towards your house.

People wonder occasionally what guild you’re associated with. The answer is, of course, none. There weren’t any exploration guilds left; not after the mystery dungeons all closed up one fateful day, sealing whatever Pokemon who were unlucky enough to be caught inside within them forever. No, no, no… you were just a freelance team. You were nominally dedicated to law enforcement; y’know, catching bandits, collecting bounties, keeping the peace. But the mystery of those old dungeons still lurked in your mind. Nobody had ever found a way to unlock them again, and eventually, Pokemon just stopped trying. But this key… reminded you of those dungeons, somehow. Could it be…?

“Ah! I’m almost going to miss that meganium…” Zola reminisced as she slithered into your humble home on the outskirts of town. “Hope we run into more outlaws like him soon! He was huge!” Normally, a remark like that would annoy you… but your mind was elsewhere at the moment. While Zola gets settled in, you get to work hiding the key as best you can. You needed to research the artifact’s power before you made your next move. While you were stealthily sneaking the artifact beyond a bookshelf, you almost jumped out of your skin when you heard Zola behind you. “Hey, what are ya doin’?”

“Jeez, Zola! Don’t sneak up on me like that,” you said, clutching your chest as you turned around, trying to act natural. In response, she only giggled.

“Trying to hide something from little ol’ me, huh? Don’t worry; I respect your privacy,” she smiled slyly, before changing the subject. “So, uh… I’m sorry I took so long out there, actually. It’s really getting late.” She glanced sadly out the window, staring into the night.

“Nah, it’s fine. I couldn’t have caught him without you, anyway,” you sigh, standing and walking up the creaky, wooden stairs. Your whole house was one big, circular room, though you did have a loft tucked away at the top of some stairs.

“So… want to watch a movie or something?” She asked, following you to your room.

“No, I think I’m going to call it a day,” you said, stretching as you hopped onto your bed. You were moderately surprised when the snake followed you all the way to your room. “Oh, uh, sorry, Zola. I’m gonna need some space, tonight.”

“Oh, come on! Can’t we snuggle?” She grinned.

You stared up at her, considering it, before finally shrugging your shoulders. “... oh, fine,” you said. The instant you nodded, you felt the snake’s coils wrap around you with terrifying speed! “Mmph!” Before you knew it, Zola’s body had wrapped around you like a steel vice, squeezing you gently but firmly between her coils as she curled up on your bed.

“Hehe!” She giggled, leaving only your head free from her coils as she settled in on your bed. “Good night, lil’ cheri berry!”

You catch your breath as you get comfortable in her coils. She always squeezed you a little more tightly than you were comfortable with, though the pressure all around your body was always oddly pleasant for some reason. It was better than spending the night in her stomach, at least. “Good night, Zola,” you whispered as the two of you started to drift off to sleep…

155313.content:
The Servant - Not everyone is a winner in the wild. Fortunately, not everyone's a loser either. You managed to find that not-a-loser-but-not-really-a-winner middle ground thankfully. Your role is to serve your powerful master/mistress. Said master/mistress is a powerful predator, who could easily eat you up whenever they felt like it. However, they graciously offered mercy, giving you the chance to instead serve them. Now, you're tasked with luring meals towards them, feeding them, rubbing their stuffed bellies, and whatever else they want you to do. Be warned, though. An unwilling servant makes for a much better meal.

Arena - Unfortunately, the hunt isn't always that invigorating for predators. So, a few of them have gathered up Pokemon, and are pitting them against each other in combat. Winners get to live a little longer. Losers become a meal. You could end up facing Pokemon your size, smaller than you, or larger than you. Ultimately, you wish to escape the predators' clutches. But be careful, if you're caught, you could be in trouble the next match.

Ancient Treasure - You consider yourself an explorer, seeking around the world for anything interesting. This time, you uncovered a mysterious artifact bringing about a mysterious change around/to you. Who knows what could happen when you encounter this artifact. All you know is, it can't be good.

1553131.content:
Perhaps you would be interested in the tale of Ara the Audino?

Offered as tribute to a voracious Scolipede named Rhiannon in exchange for his tribe’s safety, the young Hearing Pokemon must now carefully navigate through his new life as the mistress’ servant, least he meet the same fate as countless others: as food for the cruel and mighty predator.
1553131.title: Ara the Audino

choices: “Go lure in some more prey for me.”
“Wash me. I’ve got guests coming over.”
15531311.content:
Beneath his hands, Ara felt the bulge struggle. The life within was so desperate to escape, thrashing hard enough that a few times the bumps made would almost sock Ara in his nose despite the considerable distance between the belly and his face. Sometimes the fighting would slow and he’d hear the exhausted meal plead and beg, sometimes even sob, through the dampening flesh, before the futile flailing would start up again. The situation made the young Audino, a Pokemon whose very nature was to help and aid others, sick to his stomach, but he kept rubbing under the threat of the same fate.

Eventually the sack stopped moving completely, the prey inside drowning in the booming gluts and gurgles of digestion. The solid form of the Pokemon – Ara wasn’t sure what kind they were. Or what kind they had been – collapsed under the gentle touch of his fingers, his rubbing helping them break down into a nutritious sludge for the body to absorb and add to itself. His hands began shaking as the stomach continued getting smaller and smaller, shoving more and more of the prey-soup further into her – his mistress’ – digestive track. From above, his mistress let out a gigantic, putrid belch, setting free the last chunk of breathable air within her stomach and signaling the passing of her meal.

Ara couldn’t stop the tears forming in his eyes. He had just witnessed the power of a predator’s system, how easily it could destroy and take life to fuel it’s own. How easily it could take his life if it so wanted. He closed his eyes and tried to imagine he was somewhere else, like at home with his family or playing with his friends, but every fantasy he imagined would crumble into dust when the sound of the churning gut reached his ears. He continued rubbing, weeping quietly all the while.

His mistress was apathetic towards his muted crying. “I do hope you burn this into your mind, slave.” The huge Scolipede said as she rolled over. Her big belly slapped the unprepared Ara and knocked him to the floor as she came to stand over him. The dangling sack pressed onto him, pinning everything beneath his nose under with combined weight of both the predator’s stomach and the sloshing chyme that remained inside. Her head loomed over him, staring down with those piercing orange sclera. “This,” She said, grinding her gut against the trapped Audino. “will be your fate if you ever disobey or disappoint me. Understand?”

“Y-yes, Mistress Rhiannon.” Ara said, his voice muffled slightly under the hanging, black flesh. He fought down the urge to puke as her scent seeped into his nostrils, a horrid smell that scorched his senses and seared his brain, and waited for his mistress to free him, like a good slave would.

Rhiannon seemed satisfied with his answer, as he felt the weight slowly lift off of him. “Good.” She said and waltzed to the other side of her cave, settling beside a small pool of water as Ara stumbled to his feet. “Now, slave,” She barked as the Audino hurried over to her. “I want you to…”

You may go out to search for these Pokémon, you may tend to Pokémon you're caring for, or you may have to face dangerous predators. Will your status as predator may scare away Pokémon you'd like to help, so you might need to do more to attract them. Will you be able to save many Pokémon? Or are you going to get eaten up protecting them?

Circus - Some Pokémon have set up a traveling circus, which, on the surface, is supposed to entertain Pokémon around the world. However, in actuality, they use their game to mess with Pokémon, as well as devour them in a classic trick, and then act like they're going to release them later. Will your Pokémon be a victim of the circus? Or can you escape?

1553134111.content:
You decided you should check out the bar! After all, that would be the quickest way to look tough around here, wouldn't it? If you were seen with some alcohol in your hand, you'd definitely look cool. So, you approached. Unfortunately, as you approached, you began to feel the alcohol-y atmosphere. You found yourself walking into a cloud of pungent ethanol, which felt funny. It didn't necessarily smell bed, but you felt like you were swimming through tar as you took in breaths of the bar-atmosphere. You covered up your nose to block out the smell, hoping that'd help you feel less dizzy.

You kept progressing, and soon got on a stool. Now that you weren't struggling with the smell, you began to take in the room around you. The walls were lined with thin, lavender curtains, thin enough for you to see silhouettes of mienshaos, each picking up trays of drinks before coming out from the curtains and approaching the many tables within. The tables were upon a black floor, with silver-y trimmings within it and lavender carpets around the floor. The bar counter you were at itself seemed to be made of mahogany, but looked like a light purple shade. Past the counter, you could see several taps, each attached to their own brew.

Next to those taps, you could see the bartender, a fairly big blaziken. You realized she was about 3x your height! She also had legs as thick as tree trunks, abs toned enough to grind meat, and breasts bigger than your head. You felt yourself blush upon seeing her. Even moreso when you noticed the look she gave you once she turned towards you. She froze up, surprised at seeing you. Suddenly, you felt like you were in trouble. She approached you.

"Hey there, bud," she said in a gruff voice. She sounded like she was about to get in a fight. "Don't you think you're a bit young to be here?" You realized you were looking exceptionally puny to her. You felt insulted. While stil lhot and bothered, you couldn't just let yourself look lame to her!

"I-I'm not young!" you angrily declared. "I-I'm just short..." WIth that, she shrugged. You felt like you might've attracted more attention to yourself, though you didn't dare to look to see who noticed. Now, you felt like you should do something to erase that little outburst...
